tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V1.56.22 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, which included Tottenham Hotspur v Liverpool at White Hart Lane and Hull City v Manchester United at the KCOM Stadium. The Reds have been handed a tricky set of fixtures to start the season, but their recent record against Spurs is outstanding.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty presents a discussion of the banning of the burkini from French beaches. Plus, Nick Robinson talks about being diagnosed with cancer.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a former florist's shop in Glamorgan, south Wales, a three-bedroom terraced house in Chatham, Kent, and a plot of land in Derby, and then follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings. After three months the team returns to review their progress.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Continent
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman heads to the Vendee region of France with a London couple who are hoping to relocate there with their young family on a budget of £600,000.(n)

programme.title: Summer: Earth's Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: With the sun shining and the flowers blooming, summer is a season of splendid abundance, and the long hours of daylight make life burst out in a riot of activity. However, in certain regions there can be sweltering heat. As this documentary reveals, for a range of species, from sneaky ringtailed lemurs to battling ibex and penguins to colour-changing lizards, summer is a time when the living is not always easy. Narrated by Andrew Scott.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin head to Edinburgh to meet Derek Hoyland, who is coeliac and hasn't eaten the same meal as his wife and two kids for nearly 6 years, living off salads to avoid any gluten in his diet. His children Connor and Amy long to sit down as a family and all eat the same thing, but mum Clair's fear of gluten-free cooking means she prepares three separate meals every day.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Twelve contestants begin the battle to be named Britain's best amateur baker by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, who have created 30 new tasks to test their baking skills and creativity. The first signature challenge takes the bakers back to basics with a British classic, while the technical sees them tackle a popular little cake with a fatless sponge and tricky chocolate work. Finally, the competitors must impress the judges with their first showstopper, but there is nowhere to hide. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.sub-title: Rugby League Challenge Cup Fans Choir Special.
programme.desc: Aled Jones presents a programme in which the winners of the Songs of Praise Rugby League Challenge Cup Fans Choir Competition sings at Wembley for the Challenge Cup Final.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents the general knowledge quiz as famous faces from BBC radio programme Test Match Special take part, featuring Graeme Swann and Alison Mitchell, Michael Vaughan and Phil Tufnell, Melinda Farrell and Jonathan Agnew, and Ebony Rainford-Brent and Henry Blofeld. The famous faces try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Co-presenter Richard Osman has all the answers.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley meets the members of team who have used ground-penetrating radar techniques to reveal hitherto unknown features buried in the soil at Durrington Walls, not far from the site of Stonehenge in Wiltshire. He also talks to local tenant farmer Hugh Morrison to see just what sort of problem he faces farming on a World Heritage Site, while Anita Rani finds out how neolithic farmers lived by visiting reconstructions of the types of houses they lived in. Plus, John Craven is joined by fellow judges Deborah Meaden and Simon King to select the final 12 pictures for the programme's photography competition. Including weather for the week ahead.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: New series. Fiona Bruce presents the show from Tewkesbury Abbey, Gloucestershire. A visitor from Australia hopes a set of silver knives will be worth the cost of her plane ticket, while two sisters who split their great great grandmother's jewellery between them hope to find out who has the most valuable inheritance. Lennox Cato values a box that may have belonged to William Shakespeare's wife, and a collection of rare figures and dolls turns out to be a find of national importance.(n)

programme.title: Are You Being Served
programme.sub-title: You Can't Teach a New Dog Old Tricks.
programme.desc: One-off remake of the celebrated comedy set within Grace Brothers department store. It's 1988 and Young Mr Grace is determined to drag the business into, well 1988. However, he has a problem on his hands as his key employees all seem to be stuck in another era. A new member of staff - Mr Conway - joins the team - but will he help shake things up? Sherrie Hewson assumes the mantle of Mrs Slocombe alongside Jason Watkins as Mr Humphries and John Challis as Captain Peacock, while Gavin & Stacey's Mathew Horne takes on the unlikely role of Young Mr Grace. Part of the Landmark Comedy Sitcom season.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' updated version of their prison comedy, set in the present day. Kevin Bishop plays the grandson of Ronnie Barker's iconic character, who is serving a sentence for cyber crimes - and getting himself into even more trouble while completing his stretch. Ralph Ineson, Mark Bonnar and Dave Hill also star. Part of the Landmark Comedy Sitcom season.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the latest Premier League action, featuring Manchester City v West Ham United at the Etihad Stadium and West Bromwich Albion v Middlesbrough at the Hawthorns. The Hammers have already played Chelsea away and faced another stern test of their credentials against the title favourites.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Connections
programme.desc: The story behind department store-based sitcom Are You Being Served? The show's stars, including Mollie Sugden, Frank Thornton, Wendy Richard and John Inman, reveal how actress Joanna Lumley and a Piccadilly shop inspired writers David Croft and Jeremy Lloyd to pen the series. The reasons why the programme has remained immensely popular through the years are also examined.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Connections
programme.desc: The story behind prison-based sitcom Porridge, and a chance to discover which actor was originally earmarked for the part of Godber. The programme reveals how the series was conceived and features contributions by Dick Clement, Ian La Frenais and Ronnie Barker himself.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright returns with the consumer rights show, beginning with reports on counterfeit lifesaving equipment and fake cashmere being sold online.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin assess a Victorian flat in Brixton, London, a former pub in Crumlin, Caerphilly and a flat in Telford, Shropshire.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with Richele Barker and her mother Lorraine to see whether they decided on a move to New Zealand after spending a week in Auckland two years ago.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives uncover a tale of adoption, the workhouse and illegitimacy while investigating the history of a quiet man in St Albans, and a letter from the Queen found in a derelict home in Kent leads them to the closely knit deaf community of the late 19th century.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Caroline Hawley join two teams to compete at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire, before selling their purchases at auction. Tim Wonnacott visits the Royal Artillery Museum in London, where he discovers items that once belonged to famous wartime figures.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Davey Webb is caught between Laser and the law, while James bends rules to help. Adrijan is unusually aggressive and Angela hopes for a romantic evening.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore heads to Witley to save three more items destined for the trash, including copper pipes, which give Josh and Oli a headache, and some old floor boards.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team are in Sheffield, where Thomas Plant is taken by a set of watercolours and James Lewis finds a Victorian automaton that causes a stir in the auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
programme.desc: Bill Paterson narrates highlights of the event held on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle, with this year's edition marking the Queen's 90th birthday. Those taking part include the Nepal Army Band, the Band of Her Majesty's Royal Marines, the Jordanian Royal Guard, Band and Drill Team, the Locheil Marching Drill Team, the New Zealand Army Band and the Band and Drill Team of the King of Norway's Guard as well as the Massed Pipes and Drums, the Tattoo Highland Dancers and the Imps Motorcycle Display Team.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Louise grows suspicious of Ben's behaviour, Bex seeks advice from Stacey, and Steven is frustrated when Lauren buys a laptop to help her pitch for new business, despite the financial difficulties at Beale's continuing to grow.(n)

programme.title: Thor: The Dark World
programme.desc: Premiere. The alien thunder god returns to Earth when a powerful weapon from the dawn of time is discovered. The device attracts the attention of an old enemy of his people, who intends to use it to plunge the universe into darkness - and to stop him, Thor must form an uneasy alliance with his treacherous brother Loki. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston and Natalie Portman.(n)

programme.title: Class of 92: Out of Their League
programme.sub-title: Class of 92: Still Out of Their League.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary following Salford City FC returns, as the semi-professional football club owned by former Manchester United stars Ryan Giggs, Gary and Phil Neville, Paul Scholes and Nicky Butt try to win back-to-back promotions. The squad begin their first-ever season in the Northern Premier League Premier Division, three levels below league football and six steps below the Premier League, but it soon becomes clear that life in a higher tier might not be a fairytale story, despite a thrilling run in the FA Cup.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Whitehall, Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall guest-hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, inviting comedians to share their light-hearted views on modern life. Tonight he introduces routines by Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.(n)

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.desc: The probate detectives uncover a tale of adoption, the workhouse and illegitimacy while investigating the history of a quiet man in St Albans, and a letter from the Queen found in a derelict home in Kent leads them to the closely knit deaf community of the late 19th century.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Caroline Hawley join two teams to compete at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire, before selling their purchases at auction. Tim Wonnacott visits the Royal Artillery Museum in London, where he discovers items that once belonged to famous wartime figures.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Davey Webb is caught between Laser and the law, while James bends rules to help. Adrijan is unusually aggressive and Angela hopes for a romantic evening.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore heads to Witley to save three more items destined for the trash, including copper pipes, which give Josh and Oli a headache, and some old floor boards.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: Scotland at the Games
programme.desc: A review of Scotland's contribution to Team GB's success at Rio 2016, the best-ever performance at an Olympics on foreign soil, which saw the likes of Callum Skinner, Katie Archibald, Andy Murray and Heather Stanning win gold medals.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels the country to trace the changes that have taken place since the birth of Scottish tourism two centuries ago. Using a variety of unusual means of transport, including a Victorian tricycle and a Shetland pony, he visits an array of unspoilt destinations and learns about the richness of the local landscape.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
programme.desc: Bill Paterson narrates highlights of the event held on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle, with this year's edition marking the Queen's 90th birthday. Those taking part include the Nepal Army Band, the Band of Her Majesty's Royal Marines, the Jordanian Royal Guard, Band and Drill Team, the Locheil Marching Drill Team, the New Zealand Army Band and the Band and Drill Team of the King of Norway's Guard as well as the Massed Pipes and Drums, the Tattoo Highland Dancers and the Imps Motorcycle Display Team.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Louise grows suspicious of Ben's behaviour, Bex seeks advice from Stacey, and Steven is frustrated when Lauren buys a laptop to help her pitch for new business, despite the financial difficulties at Beale's continuing to grow.(n)

programme.title: Thor: The Dark World
programme.desc: Premiere. The alien thunder god returns to Earth when a powerful weapon from the dawn of time is discovered. The device attracts the attention of an old enemy of his people, who intends to use it to plunge the universe into darkness - and to stop him, Thor must form an uneasy alliance with his treacherous brother Loki. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston and Natalie Portman.(n)

programme.title: The Supreme Sacrifice
programme.desc: Documentary examining how, in 1914, the British public demanded that the professional football season be suspended so players could fight in the war. At the time, the Heart of Midlothian squad were enjoying a spectacular run of success, and had recently made their mark as the best side in the country, but were put under extreme pressure to sign up for service. Eleven members of the team enlisted, and a number of them were subsequently killed in the Battle of the Somme. Narrated by Ken Stott, the programme features archive footage and veterans' memoirs, alongside contributions by historian Jack Alexander - who campaigned for a memorial to be erected on the battlefield.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Whitehall, Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall guest-hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, inviting comedians to share their light-hearted views on modern life. Tonight he introduces routines by Josh Widdicombe and Shappi Khorsandi.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, which included Tottenham Hotspur v Liverpool at White Hart Lane and Hull City v Manchester United at the KCOM Stadium. The Reds have been handed a tricky set of fixtures to start the season, but their recent record against Spurs is outstanding.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty presents a discussion of the banning of the burkini from French beaches. Plus, Nick Robinson talks about being diagnosed with cancer.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a former florist's shop in Glamorgan, south Wales, a three-bedroom terraced house in Chatham, Kent, and a plot of land in Derby, and then follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings. After three months the team returns to review their progress.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Continent
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman heads to the Vendee region of France with a London couple who are hoping to relocate there with their young family on a budget of £600,000.(n)

programme.title: Summer: Earth's Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: With the sun shining and the flowers blooming, summer is a season of splendid abundance, and the long hours of daylight make life burst out in a riot of activity. However, in certain regions there can be sweltering heat. As this documentary reveals, for a range of species, from sneaky ringtailed lemurs to battling ibex and penguins to colour-changing lizards, summer is a time when the living is not always easy. Narrated by Andrew Scott.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin head to Edinburgh to meet Derek Hoyland, who is coeliac and hasn't eaten the same meal as his wife and two kids for nearly 6 years, living off salads to avoid any gluten in his diet. His children Connor and Amy long to sit down as a family and all eat the same thing, but mum Clair's fear of gluten-free cooking means she prepares three separate meals every day.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Twelve contestants begin the battle to be named Britain's best amateur baker by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, who have created 30 new tasks to test their baking skills and creativity. The first signature challenge takes the bakers back to basics with a British classic, while the technical sees them tackle a popular little cake with a fatless sponge and tricky chocolate work. Finally, the competitors must impress the judges with their first showstopper, but there is nowhere to hide. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.sub-title: Rugby League Challenge Cup Fans Choir Special.
programme.desc: Aled Jones presents a programme in which the winners of the Songs of Praise Rugby League Challenge Cup Fans Choir Competition sings at Wembley for the Challenge Cup Final.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents the general knowledge quiz as famous faces from BBC radio programme Test Match Special take part, featuring Graeme Swann and Alison Mitchell, Michael Vaughan and Phil Tufnell, Melinda Farrell and Jonathan Agnew, and Ebony Rainford-Brent and Henry Blofeld. The famous faces try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Co-presenter Richard Osman has all the answers.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley meets the members of team who have used ground-penetrating radar techniques to reveal hitherto unknown features buried in the soil at Durrington Walls, not far from the site of Stonehenge in Wiltshire. He also talks to local tenant farmer Hugh Morrison to see just what sort of problem he faces farming on a World Heritage Site, while Anita Rani finds out how neolithic farmers lived by visiting reconstructions of the types of houses they lived in. Plus, John Craven is joined by fellow judges Deborah Meaden and Simon King to select the final 12 pictures for the programme's photography competition. Including weather for the week ahead.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: New series. Fiona Bruce presents the show from Tewkesbury Abbey, Gloucestershire. A visitor from Australia hopes a set of silver knives will be worth the cost of her plane ticket, while two sisters who split their great great grandmother's jewellery between them hope to find out who has the most valuable inheritance. Lennox Cato values a box that may have belonged to William Shakespeare's wife, and a collection of rare figures and dolls turns out to be a find of national importance.(n)

programme.title: Are You Being Served
programme.sub-title: You Can't Teach a New Dog Old Tricks.
programme.desc: One-off remake of the celebrated comedy set within Grace Brothers department store. It's 1988 and Young Mr Grace is determined to drag the business into, well 1988. However, he has a problem on his hands as his key employees all seem to be stuck in another era. A new member of staff - Mr Conway - joins the team - but will he help shake things up? Sherrie Hewson assumes the mantle of Mrs Slocombe alongside Jason Watkins as Mr Humphries and John Challis as Captain Peacock, while Gavin & Stacey's Mathew Horne takes on the unlikely role of Young Mr Grace. Part of the Landmark Comedy Sitcom season.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' updated version of their prison comedy, set in the present day. Kevin Bishop plays the grandson of Ronnie Barker's iconic character, who is serving a sentence for cyber crimes - and getting himself into even more trouble while completing his stretch. Ralph Ineson, Mark Bonnar and Dave Hill also star. Part of the Landmark Comedy Sitcom season.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the latest Premier League action, featuring Manchester City v West Ham United at the Etihad Stadium and West Bromwich Albion v Middlesbrough at the Hawthorns. The Hammers have already played Chelsea away and faced another stern test of their credentials against the title favourites.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Connections
programme.desc: The story behind department store-based sitcom Are You Being Served? The show's stars, including Mollie Sugden, Frank Thornton, Wendy Richard and John Inman, reveal how actress Joanna Lumley and a Piccadilly shop inspired writers David Croft and Jeremy Lloyd to pen the series. The reasons why the programme has remained immensely popular through the years are also examined.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Connections
programme.desc: The story behind prison-based sitcom Porridge, and a chance to discover which actor was originally earmarked for the part of Godber. The programme reveals how the series was conceived and features contributions by Dick Clement, Ian La Frenais and Ronnie Barker himself.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright returns with the consumer rights show, beginning with reports on counterfeit lifesaving equipment and fake cashmere being sold online.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin assess a Victorian flat in Brixton, London, a former pub in Crumlin, Caerphilly and a flat in Telford, Shropshire.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with Richele Barker and her mother Lorraine to see whether they decided on a move to New Zealand after spending a week in Auckland two years ago.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives uncover a tale of adoption, the workhouse and illegitimacy while investigating the history of a quiet man in St Albans, and a letter from the Queen found in a derelict home in Kent leads them to the closely knit deaf community of the late 19th century.(n)

programme.desc: David Harper and Caroline Hawley join two teams to compete at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire, before selling their purchases at auction. Tim Wonnacott visits the Royal Artillery Museum in London, where he discovers items that once belonged to famous wartime figures.(n)

programme.title: BBC Wales Today; Weather
programme.desc: News and weather from BBC Wales.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Davey Webb is caught between Laser and the law, while James bends rules to help. Adrijan is unusually aggressive and Angela hopes for a romantic evening.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore heads to Witley to save three more items destined for the trash, including copper pipes, which give Josh and Oli a headache, and some old floor boards.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team are in Sheffield, where Thomas Plant is taken by a set of watercolours and James Lewis finds a Victorian automaton that causes a stir in the auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: BBC Wales Today; Weather
programme.desc: News and weather from BBC Wales.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
programme.desc: Bill Paterson narrates highlights of the event held on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle, with this year's edition marking the Queen's 90th birthday. Those taking part include the Nepal Army Band, the Band of Her Majesty's Royal Marines, the Jordanian Royal Guard, Band and Drill Team, the Locheil Marching Drill Team, the New Zealand Army Band and the Band and Drill Team of the King of Norway's Guard as well as the Massed Pipes and Drums, the Tattoo Highland Dancers and the Imps Motorcycle Display Team.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Louise grows suspicious of Ben's behaviour, Bex seeks advice from Stacey, and Steven is frustrated when Lauren buys a laptop to help her pitch for new business, despite the financial difficulties at Beale's continuing to grow.(n)

programme.title: Thor: The Dark World
programme.desc: Premiere. The alien thunder god returns to Earth when a powerful weapon from the dawn of time is discovered. The device attracts the attention of an old enemy of his people, who intends to use it to plunge the universe into darkness - and to stop him, Thor must form an uneasy alliance with his treacherous brother Loki. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston and Natalie Portman.(n)

programme.title: Rob Brydon at 50
programme.desc: Welsh comedian, actor and presenter Rob Brydon retraces his rocky road to success, from his early days in Porthcawl to the bright lights of Hollywood. The programme features a host of famous friends who joined Rob on his journey, including Tom Jones, Steve Coogan, Ruth Jones and David Walliams.(n)

programme.title: Class of 92: Out of Their League
programme.sub-title: Class of 92: Still Out of Their League.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary following Salford City FC returns, as the semi-professional football club owned by former Manchester United stars Ryan Giggs, Gary and Phil Neville, Paul Scholes and Nicky Butt try to win back-to-back promotions. The squad begin their first-ever season in the Northern Premier League Premier Division, three levels below league football and six steps below the Premier League, but it soon becomes clear that life in a higher tier might not be a fairytale story, despite a thrilling run in the FA Cup.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at themes beginning with the letter E, as part of her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: Horticulturist Christine Walkden explores Hampshire by hot-air balloon, beginning at Mottisfont Abbey in Romsey, where she meets a gardening veteran who is preparing to hand over his duties to a young protegee. She visits the Sir Harold Hillier Gardens, and also climbs into a pair of waders for a go at an unusual kind of weeding.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explains how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill visits RHS Rosemoor to catch up on the vegetable trials that she started earlier in the year, while Alan Power heads to Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus originally included in the planting plans of horticulturist Gertrude Jekyll over a century ago.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker presents highlights from Countryfile Live, the event held earlier this month at Blenheim Palace in Oxfordshire. Ellie Harrison meets the estate's owner, the Duke of Marlborough, while Anita Rani takes a look at Blenheim's 1,000-year-old oak trees. John Craven explores the ornamental lakes to see how ducks are helping to restore them, while Charlotte Smith reports on what the future holds for British food protected under EU law.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter tastes the peas and sweet peas at Beechgrove, having run an observation on varieties of peas and their support systems, and now it is time for harvest and analysis. George Anderson returns to his roots as he visits Athelstaneford village near North Berwick, where 12 village gardens are gearing up for an open day, and Jim McColl visits Douneside House at Tarland to meet head hardener Stephen McCallum.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: James Martin presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen. Featuring an archive programme presented by Rick Stein.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine Pascale: How to Be a Better Cook
programme.desc: Neil Forster is an impatient cook who reaches for the takeaway menu rather than making food from scratch. Lorraine shows him recipes including asparagus and cream cheese puff pastry tarts, a quick way to do a roast chicken and a neat shortcut to prepare a summer fruits pudding.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef makes a beef and red wine pie, a chicken fricassee and home-made marshmallows in a chocolate winter sauce, all designed to provide warmth on a cold winter's night. Plus, he meets farmers producing high quality salt marsh beef and one of only three pure chocolate producers in the UK.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with the Match of the Day team, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Meeting Areva. Gabby Logan presents action from the 12th Diamond League event of the season, which was held at Stade de France in Saint-Denis, Paris.(n)

programme.title: None But the Brave
programme.desc: American servicemen crash-land on a remote Pacific island and discover it is already occupied by a stranded Japanese platoon. Both sides grudgingly agree to suspend hostilities and tend their wounded - but only until radio communication is established and rescue arrives. Second World War adventure, directed by and starring Frank Sinatra, with Clint Walker, Tommy Sands, Brad Dexter, Tony Bill, Tatsuya Mihashi and Takeshi Kato.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Michael Baggot and David Fletcher assess items brought in by the public at the De La Warr Pavilion in Bexhill-on-Sea, East Sussex, including a collection of football memorabilia and a set of Tiffany silver spoons, before helping sell them at auction. Presenter Paul Martin monitors their progress and also visits Chiddingstone Castle in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble: My Welsh Sheepdog's Tale
programme.sub-title: Kate Humble: My Sheepdog and Me.
programme.desc: The broadcaster sets out to breed Welsh sheepdog puppies from her beloved pet Teg, learns about the threat facing British herding dogs and tries to train Teg to work in the traditional Welsh way. Along the way, Kate meets a team at the University of Aberystwyth whose groundbreaking DNA research reveals some remarkable facts about the breed, and if Teg can produce a litter of healthy puppies, it would play a big part in helping one of Britain's unique herding dogs survive for generations to come.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off: An Extra Slice
programme.desc: Jo Brand shines a spotlight on the best, the worst and the `must try harder next time' bakes from cake week, inviting the thoughts of a panel of Bake Off fans. Featuring exclusive footage from the BBC One show and an interview with the baker most recently told to vacate the tent.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Following the efforts being made by scientists, conservationists and local people in the Highlands as they work to repair the damage of the past and rebuild wild landscapes and habitats. The programme meets Dave Anderson from Forestry Commission Scotland and his colleague Simon Smith as they tag and monitor red kite and osprey chicks, gaining a unique perspective of the lives of the birds before they fly the nest. Cameras also capture the efforts of the Scottish Wildcat Action Plan team, as well as Paul Lister's project to reintroduce wolves and bears to his Alladale Wilderness Reserve. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Cats v Dogs: Which Is Best
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Liz Bonnin present the second of two programmes in which pooches and pussies are put through a number of tests to see which family pet comes out on top. There are five more rounds, concentrating on which animal is easiest to train, communication, which is best at helping reduce people's stress, independence and the big question - do cats and dogs really love their owners? On the search for answers, dog-lover Chris meets a Border Collie which can recognise more than 150 words and Liz meets a cat capable of choosing its own TV channels.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the final, featuring the five heat winners and one of the runners-up. Judges Sethu Vijayakumar, Noel Sharkey and Dr Lucy Rodgers decide the winner, while Jonathan Pearce provides commentary on the mayhem. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A merchant navy officer-turned-product designer demonstrates his tablet holder, while two proud parents pitch their organic skincare product for babies. A young entrepreneur hopes to impress with his activity monitor for pets, but will the Dragons see the potential in his innovative product, or will he be left in the dog house? Presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Fleabag
programme.desc: Haunted by memories of her dead best friend, dumped by her emotionally fragile boyfriend, and now desperately trying to sell her stolen goods, Fleabag attempts to rekindle romantic fires to distract her from the mayhem of her life. Comedy, written by and starring Phoebe Waller-Bridge.(n)

programme.title: Murder in Successville
programme.desc: This week DI Sleet is joined by TV personality Mark Wright and the duo are teamed with the task of eradicating a new lethal drug, nicknamed Miranda. Before long, their shady snitch Daniel Radcliffe is shot dead, and the detectives need to decide which of suspects Paul Hollywood, Tess Daly, Claudia Winkleman and Frankie Boyle committed the crime.(n)

programme.title: Up There
programme.desc: A spirit is given the job of escorting the recently deceased to the afterlife, when all he wants to do is cross over himself. He is partnered with an annoyingly cheerful sidekick for his latest assignment, but they manage to lose the soul in question and face a frantic search through a British seaside town. Comic fantasy, starring Burn Gorman, Kate O'Flynn and Aymen Hamdouchi.(n)

programme.title: Coco Chanel & Igor Stravinsky
programme.desc: Fact-based drama examining the relationship between the fashion designer and the composer. Chanel is one of the few supporters of Stravinsky's controversial ballet The Rite of Spring, and when he is left penniless by the Russian revolution, she takes him in. A brief but passionate affair develops which influences both their work. With Anna Mouglalis and Mads Mikkelsen. In French, Russian and English.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Guy must face his past when an unexpected patient arrives at the hospital. Meanwhile, Fletch struggles with single parenthood as his work and home lives collide, and Ric makes a new enemy as he campaigns for the deputy CEO role.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: At the Longleat Estate, Ben Fogle gets mobbed by a flock of rainbow-coloured lorikeets as they undergo a vital health check, while Kate Humble views a collection of giant stick insects using a special camera. Elsewhere, the park is on lock-down as they prepare to move over 30 lions, the biggest collection in Europe, into a new enclosure. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts examine properties up for auction, including a 100-year-old barn in Devon and three-bedroom homes in London and Lincolnshire. They follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, returning to review their progress a few months later.(n)

programme.title: Make Me an Egghead
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a search for the nation's best quizzing brains, with the two series winners gaining the ultimate prize of places on the panel of resident experts on Eggheads.(n)

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme Mountain Challenge
programme.desc: Part one of two. The naturalist leads a team of rock climbers across Venezuela's tepuis - sheer-sided mountains surrounded by jungle. In the first episode, he attempts an ascent of a rockface that has never been climbed previously to discover what kind of animals live at the summit. However, to get there he will have to brave wildlife, rapids and a run-in with a rickety biplane.(n)

programme.title: Now, Voyager
programme.desc: A nervous and frustrated spinster undergoes psychiatric treatment and emerges transformed. Despite her new-found happiness and optimistic outlook on life, she finds that beauty and confidence can bring their own share of heartache. Romantic drama, starring Bette Davis, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Gladys Cooper and Bonita Granville.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Atletissima. Gabby Logan presents action from the 11th Diamond League event of the season, held at Stade Olympique de la Pontaise in Lausanne, Switzerland.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Meeting Areva. Gabby Logan presents action from the 12th Diamond League event of the season, which was held at Stade de France in Saint-Denis, Paris.(n)

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Gabby Logan, in which four contestants answer questions for the right to roll balls along cash lanes. Round by round they try to usurp their competitors in the tactical stakes of runway selection, and the nearer their balls get to The Edge the more money they bank. However if they go over, they face elimination.(n)

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Daphne reaches the end of her tether and decides it's time she came to an understanding with Sam - but is unsure whether he will co-operate. Comedy, starring Angela Thorne, Michael Elphick and Ray Burdis.(n)

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi
programme.desc: In a bid to liven up the camp, Joe Maplin decrees a weekly Sunshine Smile Day - giving perennial wide-boy Ted the perfect opportunity to fleece unsuspecting holiday-makers out of their spare cash. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.(n)

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker's latest cost-cutting scheme has won the support of the prime minister - but Sir Humphrey is still determined to undermine it. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington.(n)

programme.title: Talking Comedy
programme.desc: Angela Thorne narrates a look back at clips of the entertainer and presenter's appearances on some of the BBC's best-loved talk shows, which have become classic viewing.(n)

programme.title: Wild Wales
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the wildlife of Wales, including red deer, seals and red squirrels in Pembrokeshire. He also goes birdwatching in Glamorgan and Gwent, and visits waterfalls and caves in the Brecon Beacons.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The two remaining designers compete for a place in the quarter final, this time transforming two tiny bedrooms in medieval timber-framed houses in Sussex. The pair have very different briefs, with one designer facing the challenge of creating a Scandinavian-inspired scheme with a raised built-in bed. The other must deliver a Batman-inspired fantasy den, complete with bat motif lighting, a secret compartment, and dark grey walls. Presented by Tom Dyckhoff.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts visit Castle Coole, near Enniskillen, Co Fermanagh. Items include a poignant reminder from the battlefields of the First World War, a modern painting of an Irish landscape and a collection of compacts.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Patrick Kielty hosts a quiz show in which Carol Kirkwood, Rick Edwards and Sunetra Sarker use their knowledge and debating skills to try to help contestants win money.(n)

programme.title: Make Me an Egghead
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a search for the nation's best quizzing brains, with the two series winners gaining the ultimate prize of places on the panel of resident experts on Eggheads.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The culinary competition returns with chefs battling it out for the opportunity to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster celebrating ordinary Britons honoured by the Queen, with the contenders being challenged to showcase contemporary cuisine and demonstrate the transformation in British food during Elizabeth II's reign. The contest begins with entrants all representing Scotland for the first time, with Adam Handling, Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath preparing their starters.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the eighth of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from Robinson College, Cambridge, pit their wits against a team from Wadham College, Oxford, in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts as the Verbivores take on the Channel Islanders in the general knowledge quiz. Both teams lost in their first appearance, but now have a second chance to remain in the tournament. They must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Minotaur, Frobscottle, Moloko Plus and Duff.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: Part two of two. With the help of Major Haroun Al-Qadir, Drake continues to investigate the mysterious murder of the young Indian-born lawyer, but things get tricky when it becomes clear that their enquiries are stepping on Special Branch's toes. Meanwhile, Jackson has to come up with another idea to save Long Susan from the hangman's noose, and Reid continues to dig into the conviction of his old friend Isaac Bloom, who is also soon set to face the gallows, Period drama, starring Matthew Macfadyen and MyAnna Buring.(n)

programme.title: The Coopers vs The Rest
programme.desc: Tess wanted to save as many kids as she could from the sort of childhood she had, so she and her husband Toby adopted three children. Tess tries to improve Charlie's popularity by gatecrashing his classmate's 8th birthday party, while Toby has to deal with Alisha's sudden interest in religion. Comedy pilot, starring Paterson Joseph and Tanya Franks.(n)

programme.title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
programme.desc: A homeless youth in the ancient kingdom of Persia is adopted by the monarch and grows to become a great warrior. When the king is murdered, he is framed for the crime and forced to flee, and with the aid of a mysterious princess, he must stop a magical dagger with the power to control time from falling into evil hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Gemma Arterton and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at themes beginning with the letter E, as part of her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: Horticulturist Christine Walkden explores Hampshire by hot-air balloon, beginning at Mottisfont Abbey in Romsey, where she meets a gardening veteran who is preparing to hand over his duties to a young protegee. She visits the Sir Harold Hillier Gardens, and also climbs into a pair of waders for a go at an unusual kind of weeding.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explains how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill visits RHS Rosemoor to catch up on the vegetable trials that she started earlier in the year, while Alan Power heads to Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus originally included in the planting plans of horticulturist Gertrude Jekyll over a century ago.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker presents highlights from Countryfile Live, the event held earlier this month at Blenheim Palace in Oxfordshire. Ellie Harrison meets the estate's owner, the Duke of Marlborough, while Anita Rani takes a look at Blenheim's 1,000-year-old oak trees. John Craven explores the ornamental lakes to see how ducks are helping to restore them, while Charlotte Smith reports on what the future holds for British food protected under EU law.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter tastes the peas and sweet peas at Beechgrove, having run an observation on varieties of peas and their support systems, and now it is time for harvest and analysis. George Anderson returns to his roots as he visits Athelstaneford village near North Berwick, where 12 village gardens are gearing up for an open day, and Jim McColl visits Douneside House at Tarland to meet head hardener Stephen McCallum.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: James Martin presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen. Featuring an archive programme presented by Rick Stein.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine Pascale: How to Be a Better Cook
programme.desc: Neil Forster is an impatient cook who reaches for the takeaway menu rather than making food from scratch. Lorraine shows him recipes including asparagus and cream cheese puff pastry tarts, a quick way to do a roast chicken and a neat shortcut to prepare a summer fruits pudding.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef makes a beef and red wine pie, a chicken fricassee and home-made marshmallows in a chocolate winter sauce, all designed to provide warmth on a cold winter's night. Plus, he meets farmers producing high quality salt marsh beef and one of only three pure chocolate producers in the UK.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with the Match of the Day team, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Meeting Areva. Gabby Logan presents action from the 12th Diamond League event of the season, which was held at Stade de France in Saint-Denis, Paris.(n)

programme.title: None But the Brave
programme.desc: American servicemen crash-land on a remote Pacific island and discover it is already occupied by a stranded Japanese platoon. Both sides grudgingly agree to suspend hostilities and tend their wounded - but only until radio communication is established and rescue arrives. Second World War adventure, directed by and starring Frank Sinatra, with Clint Walker, Tommy Sands, Brad Dexter, Tony Bill, Tatsuya Mihashi and Takeshi Kato.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Michael Baggot and David Fletcher assess items brought in by the public at the De La Warr Pavilion in Bexhill-on-Sea, East Sussex, including a collection of football memorabilia and a set of Tiffany silver spoons, before helping sell them at auction. Presenter Paul Martin monitors their progress and also visits Chiddingstone Castle in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble: My Welsh Sheepdog's Tale
programme.sub-title: Kate Humble: My Sheepdog and Me.
programme.desc: The broadcaster sets out to breed Welsh sheepdog puppies from her beloved pet Teg, learns about the threat facing British herding dogs and tries to train Teg to work in the traditional Welsh way. Along the way, Kate meets a team at the University of Aberystwyth whose groundbreaking DNA research reveals some remarkable facts about the breed, and if Teg can produce a litter of healthy puppies, it would play a big part in helping one of Britain's unique herding dogs survive for generations to come.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off: An Extra Slice
programme.desc: Jo Brand shines a spotlight on the best, the worst and the `must try harder next time' bakes from cake week, inviting the thoughts of a panel of Bake Off fans. Featuring exclusive footage from the BBC One show and an interview with the baker most recently told to vacate the tent.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Following the efforts being made by scientists, conservationists and local people in the Highlands as they work to repair the damage of the past and rebuild wild landscapes and habitats. The programme meets Dave Anderson from Forestry Commission Scotland and his colleague Simon Smith as they tag and monitor red kite and osprey chicks, gaining a unique perspective of the lives of the birds before they fly the nest. Cameras also capture the efforts of the Scottish Wildcat Action Plan team, as well as Paul Lister's project to reintroduce wolves and bears to his Alladale Wilderness Reserve. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Cats v Dogs: Which Is Best
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Liz Bonnin present the second of two programmes in which pooches and pussies are put through a number of tests to see which family pet comes out on top. There are five more rounds, concentrating on which animal is easiest to train, communication, which is best at helping reduce people's stress, independence and the big question - do cats and dogs really love their owners? On the search for answers, dog-lover Chris meets a Border Collie which can recognise more than 150 words and Liz meets a cat capable of choosing its own TV channels.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the final, featuring the five heat winners and one of the runners-up. Judges Sethu Vijayakumar, Noel Sharkey and Dr Lucy Rodgers decide the winner, while Jonathan Pearce provides commentary on the mayhem. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A merchant navy officer-turned-product designer demonstrates his tablet holder, while two proud parents pitch their organic skincare product for babies. A young entrepreneur hopes to impress with his activity monitor for pets, but will the Dragons see the potential in his innovative product, or will he be left in the dog house? Presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Pop Goes Northern Ireland
programme.desc: New series. A look back at key years in the province's history, soundtracked by chart hits from the time. The series begins by returning to 1969, the time of civil rights marches and the outbreak of the Troubles.(n)

programme.title: Fleabag
programme.desc: Haunted by memories of her dead best friend, dumped by her emotionally fragile boyfriend, and now desperately trying to sell her stolen goods, Fleabag attempts to rekindle romantic fires to distract her from the mayhem of her life. Comedy, written by and starring Phoebe Waller-Bridge.(n)

programme.title: Murder in Successville
programme.desc: This week DI Sleet is joined by TV personality Mark Wright and the duo are teamed with the task of eradicating a new lethal drug, nicknamed Miranda. Before long, their shady snitch Daniel Radcliffe is shot dead, and the detectives need to decide which of suspects Paul Hollywood, Tess Daly, Claudia Winkleman and Frankie Boyle committed the crime.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by James Acaster, Ed Byrne, Sara Pascoe and Josh Widdicombe on the topical comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Darryl Grimason swims with sharks as he continues his underwater exploration of Northern Ireland's coastline.(n)

programme.title: Coco Chanel & Igor Stravinsky
programme.desc: Fact-based drama examining the relationship between the fashion designer and the composer. Chanel is one of the few supporters of Stravinsky's controversial ballet The Rite of Spring, and when he is left penniless by the Russian revolution, she takes him in. A brief but passionate affair develops which influences both their work. With Anna Mouglalis and Mads Mikkelsen. In French, Russian and English.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Guy must face his past when an unexpected patient arrives at the hospital. Meanwhile, Fletch struggles with single parenthood as his work and home lives collide, and Ric makes a new enemy as he campaigns for the deputy CEO role.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: At the Longleat Estate, Ben Fogle gets mobbed by a flock of rainbow-coloured lorikeets as they undergo a vital health check, while Kate Humble views a collection of giant stick insects using a special camera. Elsewhere, the park is on lock-down as they prepare to move over 30 lions, the biggest collection in Europe, into a new enclosure. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts examine properties up for auction, including a 100-year-old barn in Devon and three-bedroom homes in London and Lincolnshire. They follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, returning to review their progress a few months later.(n)

programme.title: Make Me an Egghead
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a search for the nation's best quizzing brains, with the two series winners gaining the ultimate prize of places on the panel of resident experts on Eggheads.(n)

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme Mountain Challenge
programme.desc: Part one of two. The naturalist leads a team of rock climbers across Venezuela's tepuis - sheer-sided mountains surrounded by jungle. In the first episode, he attempts an ascent of a rockface that has never been climbed previously to discover what kind of animals live at the summit. However, to get there he will have to brave wildlife, rapids and a run-in with a rickety biplane.(n)

programme.title: Now, Voyager
programme.desc: A nervous and frustrated spinster undergoes psychiatric treatment and emerges transformed. Despite her new-found happiness and optimistic outlook on life, she finds that beauty and confidence can bring their own share of heartache. Romantic drama, starring Bette Davis, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Gladys Cooper and Bonita Granville.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Atletissima. Gabby Logan presents action from the 11th Diamond League event of the season, held at Stade Olympique de la Pontaise in Lausanne, Switzerland.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Meeting Areva. Gabby Logan presents action from the 12th Diamond League event of the season, which was held at Stade de France in Saint-Denis, Paris.(n)

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Gabby Logan, in which four contestants answer questions for the right to roll balls along cash lanes. Round by round they try to usurp their competitors in the tactical stakes of runway selection, and the nearer their balls get to The Edge the more money they bank. However if they go over, they face elimination.(n)

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Daphne reaches the end of her tether and decides it's time she came to an understanding with Sam - but is unsure whether he will co-operate. Comedy, starring Angela Thorne, Michael Elphick and Ray Burdis.(n)

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi
programme.desc: In a bid to liven up the camp, Joe Maplin decrees a weekly Sunshine Smile Day - giving perennial wide-boy Ted the perfect opportunity to fleece unsuspecting holiday-makers out of their spare cash. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.(n)

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker's latest cost-cutting scheme has won the support of the prime minister - but Sir Humphrey is still determined to undermine it. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington.(n)

programme.title: Talking Comedy
programme.desc: Angela Thorne narrates a look back at clips of the entertainer and presenter's appearances on some of the BBC's best-loved talk shows, which have become classic viewing.(n)

programme.title: Wild Wales
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the wildlife of Wales, including red deer, seals and red squirrels in Pembrokeshire. He also goes birdwatching in Glamorgan and Gwent, and visits waterfalls and caves in the Brecon Beacons.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The two remaining designers compete for a place in the quarter final, this time transforming two tiny bedrooms in medieval timber-framed houses in Sussex. The pair have very different briefs, with one designer facing the challenge of creating a Scandinavian-inspired scheme with a raised built-in bed. The other must deliver a Batman-inspired fantasy den, complete with bat motif lighting, a secret compartment, and dark grey walls. Presented by Tom Dyckhoff.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts visit Castle Coole, near Enniskillen, Co Fermanagh. Items include a poignant reminder from the battlefields of the First World War, a modern painting of an Irish landscape and a collection of compacts.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Patrick Kielty hosts a quiz show in which Carol Kirkwood, Rick Edwards and Sunetra Sarker use their knowledge and debating skills to try to help contestants win money.(n)

programme.title: Make Me an Egghead
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a search for the nation's best quizzing brains, with the two series winners gaining the ultimate prize of places on the panel of resident experts on Eggheads.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The culinary competition returns with chefs battling it out for the opportunity to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster celebrating ordinary Britons honoured by the Queen, with the contenders being challenged to showcase contemporary cuisine and demonstrate the transformation in British food during Elizabeth II's reign. The contest begins with entrants all representing Scotland for the first time, with Adam Handling, Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath preparing their starters.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the eighth of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from Robinson College, Cambridge, pit their wits against a team from Wadham College, Oxford, in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts as the Verbivores take on the Channel Islanders in the general knowledge quiz. Both teams lost in their first appearance, but now have a second chance to remain in the tournament. They must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Minotaur, Frobscottle, Moloko Plus and Duff.(n)

Meanwhile, Jackson has to come up with another idea to save Long Susan from the hangman's noose, and Reid continues to dig into the conviction of his old friend Isaac Bloom, who is also soon set to face the gallows, Period drama, starring Matthew Macfadyen and MyAnna Buring.(n)

programme.title: Ar Scath na Sleibhte
programme.desc: Cormac O hÁdhmaill returns to explore more of the mountains of Northern Ireland, meeting the people who live and work around them. He begins by walking along the coast and through the glens of Co Antrim in search of the story of the Feis na nGleann, and also visits Glenarm Castle. In Irish.(n)

programme.title: The Coopers vs The Rest
programme.desc: Tess wanted to save as many kids as she could from the sort of childhood she had, so she and her husband Toby adopted three children. Tess tries to improve Charlie's popularity by gatecrashing his classmate's 8th birthday party, while Toby has to deal with Alisha's sudden interest in religion. Comedy pilot, starring Paterson Joseph and Tanya Franks.(n)

programme.title: Up There
programme.desc: A spirit is given the job of escorting the recently deceased to the afterlife, when all he wants to do is cross over himself. He is partnered with an annoyingly cheerful sidekick for his latest assignment, but they manage to lose the soul in question and face a frantic search through a British seaside town. Comic fantasy, starring Burn Gorman, Kate O'Flynn and Aymen Hamdouchi.(n)

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Jonathan Sutherland presents highlights from the Scottish Premiership, including Celtic v Aberdeen at Celtic Park, Motherwell v Dundee at Fir Park and Kilmarnock v Rangers at Rugby Park.(n)

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: Annie makes a choice between telling the truth and saving Alex from being charged. Meanwhile, Jimmy's caught in the crossfire when's he's forced to choose between Lenny or Kelly-Marie. Will Gabriel survive the assault, and will DI Donald trick Alex and Amber into admitting their guilt?.(n)
