When the king is murdered, he is framed for the crime and forced to flee, and with the aid of a mysterious princess, he must stop a magical dagger with the power to control time from falling into evil hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Gemma Arterton and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at themes beginning with the letter E, as part of her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: Horticulturist Christine Walkden explores Hampshire by hot-air balloon, beginning at Mottisfont Abbey in Romsey, where she meets a gardening veteran who is preparing to hand over his duties to a young protegee. She visits the Sir Harold Hillier Gardens, and also climbs into a pair of waders for a go at an unusual kind of weeding.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explains how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill visits RHS Rosemoor to catch up on the vegetable trials that she started earlier in the year, while Alan Power heads to Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus originally included in the planting plans of horticulturist Gertrude Jekyll over a century ago.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker presents highlights from Countryfile Live, the event held earlier this month at Blenheim Palace in Oxfordshire. Ellie Harrison meets the estate's owner, the Duke of Marlborough, while Anita Rani takes a look at Blenheim's 1,000-year-old oak trees. John Craven explores the ornamental lakes to see how ducks are helping to restore them, while Charlotte Smith reports on what the future holds for British food protected under EU law.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter tastes the peas and sweet peas at Beechgrove, having run an observation on varieties of peas and their support systems, and now it is time for harvest and analysis. George Anderson returns to his roots as he visits Athelstaneford village near North Berwick, where 12 village gardens are gearing up for an open day, and Jim McColl visits Douneside House at Tarland to meet head hardener Stephen McCallum.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: James Martin presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen. Featuring an archive programme presented by Rick Stein.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine Pascale: How to Be a Better Cook
programme.desc: Neil Forster is an impatient cook who reaches for the takeaway menu rather than making food from scratch. Lorraine shows him recipes including asparagus and cream cheese puff pastry tarts, a quick way to do a roast chicken and a neat shortcut to prepare a summer fruits pudding.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef makes a beef and red wine pie, a chicken fricassee and home-made marshmallows in a chocolate winter sauce, all designed to provide warmth on a cold winter's night. Plus, he meets farmers producing high quality salt marsh beef and one of only three pure chocolate producers in the UK.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with the Match of the Day team, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Meeting Areva. Gabby Logan presents action from the 12th Diamond League event of the season, which was held at Stade de France in Saint-Denis, Paris.(n)

programme.title: None But the Brave
programme.desc: American servicemen crash-land on a remote Pacific island and discover it is already occupied by a stranded Japanese platoon. Both sides grudgingly agree to suspend hostilities and tend their wounded - but only until radio communication is established and rescue arrives. Second World War adventure, directed by and starring Frank Sinatra, with Clint Walker, Tommy Sands, Brad Dexter, Tony Bill, Tatsuya Mihashi and Takeshi Kato.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Michael Baggot and David Fletcher assess items brought in by the public at the De La Warr Pavilion in Bexhill-on-Sea, East Sussex, including a collection of football memorabilia and a set of Tiffany silver spoons, before helping sell them at auction. Presenter Paul Martin monitors their progress and also visits Chiddingstone Castle in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble: My Welsh Sheepdog's Tale
programme.sub-title: Kate Humble: My Sheepdog and Me.
programme.desc: The broadcaster sets out to breed Welsh sheepdog puppies from her beloved pet Teg, learns about the threat facing British herding dogs and tries to train Teg to work in the traditional Welsh way. Along the way, Kate meets a team at the University of Aberystwyth whose groundbreaking DNA research reveals some remarkable facts about the breed, and if Teg can produce a litter of healthy puppies, it would play a big part in helping one of Britain's unique herding dogs survive for generations to come.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off: An Extra Slice
programme.desc: Jo Brand shines a spotlight on the best, the worst and the `must try harder next time' bakes from cake week, inviting the thoughts of a panel of Bake Off fans. Featuring exclusive footage from the BBC One show and an interview with the baker most recently told to vacate the tent.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Following the efforts being made by scientists, conservationists and local people in the Highlands as they work to repair the damage of the past and rebuild wild landscapes and habitats. The programme meets Dave Anderson from Forestry Commission Scotland and his colleague Simon Smith as they tag and monitor red kite and osprey chicks, gaining a unique perspective of the lives of the birds before they fly the nest. Cameras also capture the efforts of the Scottish Wildcat Action Plan team, as well as Paul Lister's project to reintroduce wolves and bears to his Alladale Wilderness Reserve. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Cats v Dogs: Which Is Best
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Liz Bonnin present the second of two programmes in which pooches and pussies are put through a number of tests to see which family pet comes out on top. There are five more rounds, concentrating on which animal is easiest to train, communication, which is best at helping reduce people's stress, independence and the big question - do cats and dogs really love their owners? On the search for answers, dog-lover Chris meets a Border Collie which can recognise more than 150 words and Liz meets a cat capable of choosing its own TV channels.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the final, featuring the five heat winners and one of the runners-up. Judges Sethu Vijayakumar, Noel Sharkey and Dr Lucy Rodgers decide the winner, while Jonathan Pearce provides commentary on the mayhem. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A merchant navy officer-turned-product designer demonstrates his tablet holder, while two proud parents pitch their organic skincare product for babies. A young entrepreneur hopes to impress with his activity monitor for pets, but will the Dragons see the potential in his innovative product, or will he be left in the dog house? Presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Fleabag
programme.desc: Haunted by memories of her dead best friend, dumped by her emotionally fragile boyfriend, and now desperately trying to sell her stolen goods, Fleabag attempts to rekindle romantic fires to distract her from the mayhem of her life. Comedy, written by and starring Phoebe Waller-Bridge.(n)

programme.title: Murder in Successville
programme.desc: This week DI Sleet is joined by TV personality Mark Wright and the duo are teamed with the task of eradicating a new lethal drug, nicknamed Miranda. Before long, their shady snitch Daniel Radcliffe is shot dead, and the detectives need to decide which of suspects Paul Hollywood, Tess Daly, Claudia Winkleman and Frankie Boyle committed the crime.(n)

programme.title: Up There
programme.desc: A spirit is given the job of escorting the recently deceased to the afterlife, when all he wants to do is cross over himself. He is partnered with an annoyingly cheerful sidekick for his latest assignment, but they manage to lose the soul in question and face a frantic search through a British seaside town. Comic fantasy, starring Burn Gorman, Kate O'Flynn and Aymen Hamdouchi.(n)

programme.title: Coco Chanel & Igor Stravinsky
programme.desc: Fact-based drama examining the relationship between the fashion designer and the composer. Chanel is one of the few supporters of Stravinsky's controversial ballet The Rite of Spring, and when he is left penniless by the Russian revolution, she takes him in. A brief but passionate affair develops which influences both their work. With Anna Mouglalis and Mads Mikkelsen. In French, Russian and English.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Guy must face his past when an unexpected patient arrives at the hospital. Meanwhile, Fletch struggles with single parenthood as his work and home lives collide, and Ric makes a new enemy as he campaigns for the deputy CEO role.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: At the Longleat Estate, Ben Fogle gets mobbed by a flock of rainbow-coloured lorikeets as they undergo a vital health check, while Kate Humble views a collection of giant stick insects using a special camera. Elsewhere, the park is on lock-down as they prepare to move over 30 lions, the biggest collection in Europe, into a new enclosure. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts examine properties up for auction, including a 100-year-old barn in Devon and three-bedroom homes in London and Lincolnshire. They follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, returning to review their progress a few months later.(n)

programme.title: Make Me an Egghead
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a search for the nation's best quizzing brains, with the two series winners gaining the ultimate prize of places on the panel of resident experts on Eggheads.(n)

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme Mountain Challenge
programme.desc: Part one of two. The naturalist leads a team of rock climbers across Venezuela's tepuis - sheer-sided mountains surrounded by jungle. In the first episode, he attempts an ascent of a rockface that has never been climbed previously to discover what kind of animals live at the summit. However, to get there he will have to brave wildlife, rapids and a run-in with a rickety biplane.(n)

programme.title: Now, Voyager
programme.desc: A nervous and frustrated spinster undergoes psychiatric treatment and emerges transformed. Despite her new-found happiness and optimistic outlook on life, she finds that beauty and confidence can bring their own share of heartache. Romantic drama, starring Bette Davis, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Gladys Cooper and Bonita Granville.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Atletissima. Gabby Logan presents action from the 11th Diamond League event of the season, held at Stade Olympique de la Pontaise in Lausanne, Switzerland.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Meeting Areva. Gabby Logan presents action from the 12th Diamond League event of the season, which was held at Stade de France in Saint-Denis, Paris.(n)

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Gabby Logan, in which four contestants answer questions for the right to roll balls along cash lanes. Round by round they try to usurp their competitors in the tactical stakes of runway selection, and the nearer their balls get to The Edge the more money they bank. However if they go over, they face elimination.(n)

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Daphne reaches the end of her tether and decides it's time she came to an understanding with Sam - but is unsure whether he will co-operate. Comedy, starring Angela Thorne, Michael Elphick and Ray Burdis.(n)

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi
programme.desc: In a bid to liven up the camp, Joe Maplin decrees a weekly Sunshine Smile Day - giving perennial wide-boy Ted the perfect opportunity to fleece unsuspecting holiday-makers out of their spare cash. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.(n)

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker's latest cost-cutting scheme has won the support of the prime minister - but Sir Humphrey is still determined to undermine it. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington.(n)

programme.title: Talking Comedy
programme.desc: Angela Thorne narrates a look back at clips of the entertainer and presenter's appearances on some of the BBC's best-loved talk shows, which have become classic viewing.(n)

programme.title: Wild Wales
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the wildlife of Wales, including red deer, seals and red squirrels in Pembrokeshire. He also goes birdwatching in Glamorgan and Gwent, and visits waterfalls and caves in the Brecon Beacons.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The two remaining designers compete for a place in the quarter final, this time transforming two tiny bedrooms in medieval timber-framed houses in Sussex. The pair have very different briefs, with one designer facing the challenge of creating a Scandinavian-inspired scheme with a raised built-in bed. The other must deliver a Batman-inspired fantasy den, complete with bat motif lighting, a secret compartment, and dark grey walls. Presented by Tom Dyckhoff.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts visit Castle Coole, near Enniskillen, Co Fermanagh. Items include a poignant reminder from the battlefields of the First World War, a modern painting of an Irish landscape and a collection of compacts.(n)

When the king is murdered, he is framed for the crime and forced to flee, and with the aid of a mysterious princess, he must stop a magical dagger with the power to control time from falling into evil hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Gemma Arterton and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Fort Boyard Ultimate Challenge
programme.desc: Adventure game show, in which teenage contestants from the UK and America compete in a series of quests around a fortress as they try to uncover hidden treasures. Presented by Laura Hamilton and Geno Segers.(n)

programme.title: Pat & Stan
programme.desc: Animated adventures. Pat makes friends with a spider he finds in the attic.(n)

programme.title: Dino Dan: Trek's Adventures
programme.desc: Mr Paluxy runs rats through a maze for her science class experiment and gives Trek an idea.(n)

programme.title: Dino Dan: Trek's Adventures
programme.desc: Trek has an idea on how to figure out who was smarter, the Dromaeosaurus or the Troodon.(n)

programme.title: Signed Stories
programme.sub-title: Signed Stories: Share a Story: The Cyclops Whose Eye Fell Out.
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes of the Share a Story competition, meeting the competitors and the animators who turned their stories into short films.(n)

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Sooty asks the owner of a bird garden to save the day with his clever budgies when a circus fails to turn up to entertain Richard's guests.(n)

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Tracy brothers Scott and Virgil try to find a way to shut down a dangerous device, which is capable of harnessing energy from the Aurora Borealis. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, featuring the voice of Thomas Brodie-Sangster.(n)

programme.title: Ninjago: Rise of the Snakes
programme.desc: Animation. Four ninja warriors battle dark Lord Garmadon and his skeleton army.(n)

programme.title: Weekend
programme.desc: Hart to Hart actress Stefanie Powers and Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts join Aled Jones in the studio, and balladeer Chris de Burgh speaks to the host about the release of his new album, before performing his most famous hit: The Lady in Red. Plus Georgie Barrat is on hand with the latest technology review.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A former student of Jessica's, now working as a reporter, brings the crime writer new evidence on a 30-year-old scandal involving Cabot Cove's founding families. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Amateur sleuth Jessica Fletcher is caught up in a case of mistaken identity at an airport and kidnapped by bungling crooks. Starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Troubled Waters
programme.desc: The slovenly sleuth sets out on a pleasure cruise to Acapulco. However, one of the passengers is planning to kill his lover to stop her blackmailing him, and has arranged a cast-iron alibi. But when the crime is discovered, the captain looks to Columbo to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Vaughn, Dean Stockwell, Patrick Macnee and Poupee Bocar.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The team assists 39-year-old mother of three Miriam Aragon in her search for her Salvadoran father. After growing up in Wales with her single mother and only finding out about her father's identity at the age of 19, Miriam is desperate to find him. Meanwhile, 48-year-old Annie Sims is determined to find her birth mother, who gave her up for adoption as a baby, but kept her older sister. Following the birth of her own daughters, Annie's compassion for her biological mother has grown, and she hopes to find her and hear her side of the story. Presented by Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: The X Factor
programme.desc: The long-running talent contest returns, bringing with it a reunion for the judging panel, as veterans Nicole Scherzinger, Sharon Osbourne and Louis Walsh all reclaim their seats, joining show creator Simon Cowell to assess the latest crop of would-be stars. Also coming back to the X Factor family this year is presenter Dermot O'Leary, who takes over hosting duties from Caroline Flack and Olly Murs. As ever, the contest gets under way with the auditions stage, in which Cowell and co will be expected to successfully identify the stars of tomorrow from the thousands of hopeful competitors taking to the stage.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind hopes to seal his reputation as the greatest villain of them all by stealing the moon. First he needs to get his hands on a shrinking ray owned by a rival evil genius, and adopts three orphan girls to help him - but finds that fatherhood brings out his long-buried caring side. Animated comedy, with the voices of Steve Carell, Jason Segel, Russell Brand and Julie Andrews.(n)

programme.title: Ellie Simmonds: Swimming with Dolphins
programme.desc: The gold-medal winning Paralympic athlete takes a rare break in her extensive training regime to fulfil a childhood dream - to swim with wild dolphins. Since the moment she first learned to swim at the age of three, Ellie has been inspired by the prospect of one day taking to the water alongside these ocean-bound mammals. However, an intense fear of open water means she has never dived in the ocean. Now, she sets out on a journey to conquer her phobias, one that takes her from Cardigan Bay in Wales to southern Mozambique, and the coastal waters of Ponta do Ouro. Along the way, she offers swimming lessons to young orphans, meets champion free-diver Hanli Prinsloo, and has an unexpected encounter with migrating humpback whales.(n)

programme.title: The X Factor
programme.desc: Simon Cowell and old friends/rivals Louis Walsh, Sharon Osbourne and Nicole Scherzinger preside over another round of auditions from the opening weekend, as more would-be pop icons discover whether they have a chance at stardom. Also on hand to offer congratulations or condolences is veteran X Factor host Dermot O'Leary.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: In 1838, at the age of 18, young princess Alexandrina's life is transformed when she ascends the throne of Great Britain and becomes Queen Victoria. As monarch in her own right, the young Victoria suddenly finds herself freed of the repressive shackles placed on her by her mother's advisor, Conroy, and builds a new alliance with the charismatic prime minister Lord Melbourne. However, her inexperience makes her susceptible to mistakes - and ultimately scandal. Period drama, starring Jenna Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Highlights from Snetterton, featuring the Renault UK Clio Cup and the Ginetta Junior Championship. Commentary by Richard John Neil.(n)

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Benidorm star Julie Graham talks about her role in new drama series One of Us and X Factor audition hopeful James Wilson chats about what it was like to perform in front of the judges. Ranvir Singh and Charlotte Hawkins present.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Fiona Phillips.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: Beethoven
programme.desc: An all-American family adopts a huge St Bernard, but the father is dismayed when it turns into a one-dog disaster zone. He insists the mutt must go to a new home, but when it is kidnapped by a crooked vet, dad has a change of heart and races to the rescue. Comedy, starring Charles Grodin, Bonnie Hunt, Oliver Platt and David Duchovny.(n)

programme.title: Big Star's Little Star
programme.desc: Playing to win thousands of pounds for charity this week are singer Ronan Keating, with his nine-year-old daughter Ali, actress Sheree Murphy, with her six-year-old daughter Matilda, and boxer Carl Froch, joined by his four-year-old son Rocco. Stephen Mulhern presents the entertainment show in which children spill the beans about their famous relatives.(n)

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to `see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Secret Dealers
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stevens, Simon Schneider and Mike Melody bid for a Sheffield silver inkwell by renowned makers Walker and Hall, plus a nine carat gold watch - however, things are not as they seem. Later, they visit a house full of vintage items, including rare 19th-century fire grenades.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Off Their Rockers
programme.desc: Seb learns the provocative dance move of twerking and gets tied to a lamp post, Rosie strips to reveal rather unusual undergarments and Sonia's sat-nav has a mind of its own. Hidden-camera comedy in which fearless senior citizens perform stunts and pranks on the streets of Britain.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zak insists he should join Lisa when she goes to identify Belle's body and Rhona is worried that Paddy has yet to reply to her letter telling him about her and Pierce. Holly begs Megan for another chance and Bernice stirs things up to get Andy's name cleared, while Robert insists they take it slowly.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria finally snaps and tells Eva her relationship with Aidan won't last before she crosses paths with a burglar. Meanwhile, Sally tells Phelan she may have to withdraw her support because his proposed development will mean the knocking down of the community hall.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Home Secrets
programme.desc: New series. Famous faces revisit their former homes to share their memories and secrets from when they lived there, beginning with actor Nigel Havers. He goes to the London flat where he lived when he got his first professional job aged 15, and where Mick Jagger and Keith Richards attended a celebratory party in 1967 after Nigel's father Michael Havers QC represented them at the Court of Appeal. He also goes to the basement flat in Fulham where he was living when he got his first big break in BBC mini-series A Horseman Riding By.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Caz comes to Maria's aid after she is attacked by a burglar, while Phelan uses Alex as a pawn in his plan to build on the community hall site. Elsewhere, Nick celebrates being back with Leanne, and Jenny tells Johnny how the factory staff have been taking him for a ride.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: As Lord Melbourne's popularity in the house wanes, the Tories eagerly await their imminent triumph, while the Duke of Cumberland views it as a chance to prey on his niece's vulnerability and establish a co-regency with the Duchess of Kent and Conroy. Victoria is devastated when Melbourne regretfully announces he is stepping down and even more bewildered that she must ask complete stranger Sir Robert Peel to form a government, and she desperately implores Melbourne to return. Period drama, starring Jenna Colman and Rufus Sewell.(n)

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Madge comes to terms with bad news from her doctor and makes the most of her last few days in the sun, while Mick braces himself to tell the family about her diagnosis. Kenneth decides to go on a health kick, hiring Liam as his personal trainer, and the Solana guests take part in an eating competition, organised by Cyril in his new role as assistant manager. He's keen to ensure they use the cheapest food available, and the resulting hog roast leads to the contestants taking on more than they bargained for.(n)

programme.title: Britain As Seen on ITV
programme.desc: A selection of clips showing how the representation of women on TV has changed over the past 60 years, including a report on the fashion craze of hot pants that asks whether men should be wearing them as well. Plus, a 1970s beauty contest where the contestants had the strangest of ambitions and a 1980s series from Scotland that encouraged women to take up DIY. Jane Horrocks narrates.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The heads of an Ivy-League private college tempt fate by inviting Jessica to lecture to their pupils, and it is not long before the sleuth has a murder to investigate. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Fort Boyard Ultimate Challenge
programme.desc: Adventure game show, in which teenage contestants from the UK and America compete in a series of quests around a fortress as they try to uncover hidden treasures. Presented by Laura Hamilton and Geno Segers.(n)

programme.title: Pat & Stan
programme.desc: Animated adventures. Pat makes friends with a spider he finds in the attic.(n)

programme.title: Dino Dan: Trek's Adventures
programme.desc: Mr Paluxy runs rats through a maze for her science class experiment and gives Trek an idea.(n)

programme.title: Dino Dan: Trek's Adventures
programme.desc: Trek has an idea on how to figure out who was smarter, the Dromaeosaurus or the Troodon.(n)

programme.title: Signed Stories
programme.sub-title: Signed Stories: Share a Story: The Cyclops Whose Eye Fell Out.
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes of the Share a Story competition, meeting the competitors and the animators who turned their stories into short films.(n)

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Sooty asks the owner of a bird garden to save the day with his clever budgies when a circus fails to turn up to entertain Richard's guests.(n)

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Tracy brothers Scott and Virgil try to find a way to shut down a dangerous device, which is capable of harnessing energy from the Aurora Borealis. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, featuring the voice of Thomas Brodie-Sangster.(n)

programme.title: Ninjago: Rise of the Snakes
programme.desc: Animation. Four ninja warriors battle dark Lord Garmadon and his skeleton army.(n)

programme.title: Weekend
programme.desc: Hart to Hart actress Stefanie Powers and Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts join Aled Jones in the studio, and balladeer Chris de Burgh speaks to the host about the release of his new album, before performing his most famous hit: The Lady in Red. Plus Georgie Barrat is on hand with the latest technology review.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A former student of Jessica's, now working as a reporter, brings the crime writer new evidence on a 30-year-old scandal involving Cabot Cove's founding families. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Amateur sleuth Jessica Fletcher is caught up in a case of mistaken identity at an airport and kidnapped by bungling crooks. Starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Troubled Waters
programme.desc: The slovenly sleuth sets out on a pleasure cruise to Acapulco. However, one of the passengers is planning to kill his lover to stop her blackmailing him, and has arranged a cast-iron alibi. But when the crime is discovered, the captain looks to Columbo to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Vaughn, Dean Stockwell, Patrick Macnee and Poupee Bocar.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The team assists 39-year-old mother of three Miriam Aragon in her search for her Salvadoran father. After growing up in Wales with her single mother and only finding out about her father's identity at the age of 19, Miriam is desperate to find him. Meanwhile, 48-year-old Annie Sims is determined to find her birth mother, who gave her up for adoption as a baby, but kept her older sister. Following the birth of her own daughters, Annie's compassion for her biological mother has grown, and she hopes to find her and hear her side of the story. Presented by Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: The X Factor
programme.desc: The long-running talent contest returns, bringing with it a reunion for the judging panel, as veterans Nicole Scherzinger, Sharon Osbourne and Louis Walsh all reclaim their seats, joining show creator Simon Cowell to assess the latest crop of would-be stars. Also coming back to the X Factor family this year is presenter Dermot O'Leary, who takes over hosting duties from Caroline Flack and Olly Murs. As ever, the contest gets under way with the auditions stage, in which Cowell and co will be expected to successfully identify the stars of tomorrow from the thousands of hopeful competitors taking to the stage.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind hopes to seal his reputation as the greatest villain of them all by stealing the moon. First he needs to get his hands on a shrinking ray owned by a rival evil genius, and adopts three orphan girls to help him - but finds that fatherhood brings out his long-buried caring side. Animated comedy, with the voices of Steve Carell, Jason Segel, Russell Brand and Julie Andrews.(n)

programme.title: Ellie Simmonds: Swimming with Dolphins
programme.desc: The gold-medal winning Paralympic athlete takes a rare break in her extensive training regime to fulfil a childhood dream - to swim with wild dolphins. Since the moment she first learned to swim at the age of three, Ellie has been inspired by the prospect of one day taking to the water alongside these ocean-bound mammals. However, an intense fear of open water means she has never dived in the ocean. Now, she sets out on a journey to conquer her phobias, one that takes her from Cardigan Bay in Wales to southern Mozambique, and the coastal waters of Ponta do Ouro. Along the way, she offers swimming lessons to young orphans, meets champion free-diver Hanli Prinsloo, and has an unexpected encounter with migrating humpback whales.(n)

programme.title: The X Factor
programme.desc: Simon Cowell and old friends/rivals Louis Walsh, Sharon Osbourne and Nicole Scherzinger preside over another round of auditions from the opening weekend, as more would-be pop icons discover whether they have a chance at stardom. Also on hand to offer congratulations or condolences is veteran X Factor host Dermot O'Leary.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: In 1838, at the age of 18, young princess Alexandrina's life is transformed when she ascends the throne of Great Britain and becomes Queen Victoria. As monarch in her own right, the young Victoria suddenly finds herself freed of the repressive shackles placed on her by her mother's advisor, Conroy, and builds a new alliance with the charismatic prime minister Lord Melbourne. However, her inexperience makes her susceptible to mistakes - and ultimately scandal. Period drama, starring Jenna Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Highlights from Snetterton, featuring the Renault UK Clio Cup and the Ginetta Junior Championship. Commentary by Richard John Neil.(n)

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Benidorm star Julie Graham talks about her role in new drama series One of Us and X Factor audition hopeful James Wilson chats about what it was like to perform in front of the judges. Ranvir Singh and Charlotte Hawkins present.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Fiona Phillips.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: Beethoven
programme.desc: An all-American family adopts a huge St Bernard, but the father is dismayed when it turns into a one-dog disaster zone. He insists the mutt must go to a new home, but when it is kidnapped by a crooked vet, dad has a change of heart and races to the rescue. Comedy, starring Charles Grodin, Bonnie Hunt, Oliver Platt and David Duchovny.(n)

programme.title: Big Star's Little Star
programme.desc: Playing to win thousands of pounds for charity this week are singer Ronan Keating, with his nine-year-old daughter Ali, actress Sheree Murphy, with her six-year-old daughter Matilda, and boxer Carl Froch, joined by his four-year-old son Rocco. Stephen Mulhern presents the entertainment show in which children spill the beans about their famous relatives.(n)

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to `see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Secret Dealers
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stevens, Simon Schneider and Mike Melody bid for a Sheffield silver inkwell by renowned makers Walker and Hall, plus a nine carat gold watch - however, things are not as they seem. Later, they visit a house full of vintage items, including rare 19th-century fire grenades.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. He's keen to ensure they use the cheapest food available, and the resulting hog roast leads to the contestants taking on more than they bargained for.(n)

programme.title: Draw It
programme.desc: Coronation Street star Antony Cotton (Sean Tully) and actress Denise Van Outen put their drawing skills to the test as they each pair up with a member of the public to try to help them win a cash prize. Hosted by Mel Giedroyc.(n)

programme.title: Caterham Motorsport
programme.sub-title: Motor Sport: Caterham Motorsport: 2016 Oulton Park.
programme.desc: Action from the latest race of the Caterham Championship, which took place at the Oulton Park in Cheshire.(n)

programme.title: Motor Sport: Spa Classic
programme.desc: Action from the event at Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps in Belgium, which featured a range of classic cars to from some of the greatest races in the history of the Spa 24 Hours.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frederick visits Seattle and asks Frasier to take part in the radio station softball game, leaving him with only two days to learn to play the sport. Meanwhile, Niles becomes jealous of his nephew, who has developed a crush on Daphne.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz auditions for a position as the host of a radio show. After Frasier mentions to his agent Bebe that he would be sad to see his producer go, she tells the station manager that the psychiatrist will quit if Roz is hired. Comedy, guest starring Harriet Sansom Harris.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny attempt to prove Sheldon wrong when he claims that he and Amy have a superior relationship. Meanwhile, Howard is nervous when Nasa asks him to throw the first pitch at a baseball game honouring National Space Day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's girlfriend Emily (Laura Spencer) gives Penny the cold shoulder when she learns about his past. Meanwhile, the guys debate investing in Stuart's comic-book shop and becoming part owners of the business. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by Olympic hockey champions Maddie Hinch and Alex Danson, as well as Joey Essex, Stephen Tompkinson, Anita Rani and Harry Reid.(n)

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents coverage of the 13th round of the season at the Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps (Start-time 1.00pm). Britain's Lewis Hamilton dominated the weekend here last year, converting pole position into a race win - his sixth of the season at that point - which extended his lead over Mercedes team-mate Nico Rosberg to 28 points. Hamilton would go on to pick up a second successive world championship trophy and third in total.(n)

programme.title: Guy Martin's Passion for Life
programme.desc: Documentary following the life of the motorcycle racer, offering a snapshot of some of his favourite things and showing him at work as a lorry mechanic, a job he has cycled to every day since he was 12. Guy also proudly shows off his prized possession in all its glory, the iconic Merlin engine that was the heart of the Spitfire fighter plane.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp catch up with house hunters who were looking for their dream family home. Chae and Corinna had their hearts set on finding something perfect in Fife, while single mother Jo Beck wanted a permanent home for herself and her two children in Derby.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Kevin and Monique Dixon search for a holiday home on Florida's Gulf Coast, showing them five waterside homes within their £285,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou sets sail on the high seas in a historic boat, the owner of which is seeking £750,000 to fulfil his dream of becoming a well-known children's author. Meanwhile, Lawrence is tasked with selling an original Kerry Darlington painting for a memorable returning client, and Essex girl Lucy needs an urgent loan to pay for her mother's funeral, and seeks to secure the money she requires using a diamond ring that has been in her family for generations.(n)

programme.title: Prehistoric Mega Beasts: Croc v Snake
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the unexpected discoveries made during a mining operation in Cerrejon, northern Colombia, where excavations have uncovered evidence of a prehistoric world filled with giant creatures. The largest of these was the titanoboa, a 43-foot snake that appeared to be unmatched in either size or strength. However, further findings in the region indicate that the titanoboa's supremacy may have been challenged by a giant crocodilian creature, and scientists conduct a close examination of fossilised remains to determine which of the two ruled this ancient animal kingdom.(n)

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Noel Fielding, Eddie Izzard, Alan Carr, Chelsea Peretti, Romesh Ranganathan and Dara O Briain are quizzed by Jimmy Carr on the past 100,000 years of history, with topics ranging from politics to pop music, fashion to film and art to animals. Jimmy is ably assisted by regulars Jon Snow, the children of Mitchell Brook Primary School and Joey Essex, as well as a whole host of famous question setters. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Watch
programme.desc: A small-town supermarket manager organises a neighbourhood watch group to patrol his community after a suspicious death, but finds the only recruits he can gather do not take the job seriously. They soon face a greater threat than crime when they uncover a secret alien invasion going on under their noses. Sci-fi comedy, starring Ben Stiller, Vince Vaughn, Jonah Hill and Richard Ayoade.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the 13th round of the season at the Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps.(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: The boys arrive home to find a `For Sale' sign in front of the house, and are intent on preventing their parents from selling the family home. Jim is attracted to the proposition however, and comes round as a potential buyer. Comedy, starring Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal, Tamsin Greig and Paul Ritter. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Walking the Himalayas
programme.desc: Levison Wood and guide Binod Pariyar face a 30-mile trek through the jungles of Eastern Nepal, with no roads and few people to tell them they are heading in the right direction. Their journey comes to an end in Bhutan, a country rarely visited by foreigners, where they visit a holy mountain, join the celebrations for the king's birthday, and listen to local children's tales of yeti.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two couples who wanted to buy property in Torbay, Devon. Newlyweds Sam and Jamie needed Kirstie's help to put a difficult few years behind them, while Geoff and Sharon were making the move to nearby Torquay and hoped to find a home big enough for them, their children and Sharon's mother.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time model and writer Azzi Kalili hosts the first dinner party in west London. She erects a Moroccan marquee in her garden, but seems oblivious to her freezing guests and their dislike of her food.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Plumber Steve Capel hosts the second party in west London, putting together his favourite dish, a roulade of ostrich, kudu and springbok. However, his plans to entertain the other diners with a demonstration of his nunchuk skills are cut abruptly short when an injury sustained in the kitchen comes back to haunt him.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ex-wedding planner and self-confessed perfectionist Zae Greenwood hosts the third dinner party in west London. He tries to impress his guests with a wedding-style menu, but they do not respond well to his culinary efforts.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events organiser Emma Boardman Magliocchetti hosts the penultimate dinner party in west London. She hopes to prove to her new Italian husband that she can be the perfect wife and create an incredible feast, despite never having cooked a three-course meal before.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jane Welch hosts the final dinner party in west London, and has asked her guests to appear in fancy dress. The busy mother is initially nervous about the evening and her adventurous menu, but becomes emotional when her diners compliment the meal. Plus, the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: That Darn Cat
programme.desc: A maid is accidentally kidnapped, but manages to attach a message asking for help to a cat. The animal's teenage owner goes to an FBI agent and they try to persuade the mischievous moggy to lead them to the hostage - but it is more interested in causing trouble along the way. Disney comedy remake, starring Christina Ricci, Doug E Doug and Dean Jones, who also starred in the original.(n)

programme.title: Moshi Monsters: The Movie
programme.desc: Premiere. The strange creatures discover a magical egg, but evil inventor Dr Strangeglove is determined to put it to his own nefarious purposes, and sends his minions to steal it. A small band of monsters join forces to prevent the egg from falling into the wrong hands. Animated adventure, with the voices of Emma Tate and Ashley Slater.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Girl Who Slept Too Little.
programme.desc: A construction project causes the local graveyard to be moved next to the family's home - to the dismay of Lisa, who is so concerned by the development she begins to suffer nightmares. She eventually decides the best way to conquer her fear is by facing it head on and spending a night at the cemetery.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse is dismayed to learn his estranged parents are considering a reconciliation and schemes to break them up again, helped by Bart and an idea borrowed from an episode of TV series The OC. Unfortunately, their devious scheme only succeeds in convincing Homer that Marge is having an affair.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa is so upset at Homer's failure to appreciate her lovingly crafted home-made Father's Day gift that she ends up going on a rampage through the school. Meanwhile, Bart is bullied into stealing a road sign.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Last of the Red Hat Mamas.
programme.desc: Marge joins a women's group, but soon discovers her fellow members plan to steal $1million from Mr Burns. Meanwhile, Lisa decides to spend the summer in Rome and hires a tutor to teach her Italian. Unfortunately, he turns out to be Milhouse.(n)

programme.title: Escape from Planet Earth
programme.desc: Premiere. A heroic alien space explorer travels to Earth in response to a distress call. When he ends up being captured by the military and imprisoned in the infamous Area 51, it falls to his timid, nerdy brother to save him. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Rob Corddry, Brendan Fraser and Sarah Jessica Parker.(n)

programme.title: Honey, I Blew Up the Kid
programme.desc: A scientist perfects a device for making objects grow when they come into contact with electricity. Unfortunately, his two-year-old son is accidentally turned into a giant and goes on the rampage through the streets of Las Vegas. Disney comedy sequel, starring Rick Moranis, Marcia Strassman, Robert Oliveri and Lloyd Bridges.(n)

programme.title: Wedding Town
programme.desc: Derek and Nicole are looking forward to their garden-themed ceremony, while hotel manager Gillian desperately tries to think of new ideas to drum up business.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Gloria Hunniford joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Gok's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: New parents Sara and Ryan have worked hard to get their Edwardian semi renovated and need a bit of help to get it finally finished, including an overhaul of their bedroom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first host in Cambridgeshire is science teacher Sam, who is confident his Canadian charm will pave his way to victory, while brand manager Lisa hopes to sway her guests with a night of glamour held at her mansion. Community radio producer Merlin and theatre director Julia are the other contestants in a week of dinner parties featuring uncomfortable Jacuzzi dining, unlikely celebrity lookalikes and unusual games of hide and seek.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield.
programme.desc: Ratings for Krusty's TV show start to fall, so executives bring in co-star Princess Penelope (voiced by Anne Hathaway) to increase its appeal, and romance soon blossoms between the clown and his new sidekick. Elsewhere, Mr Burns cuts costs at the nuclear plant by taking away the staff's free doughnuts.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Joe refuses to speak to Mercedes, while Diego tries to help free her from prison - but he cannot get in touch with Maria. Elsewhere, Peri suspects that Nico is connected to Tom's ill health, and Courtney and Cameron clash, with Leela caught in the middle.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Joe Wicks: The Body Coach
programme.desc: The online nutrition coach gives a group of people fitness advice and tips for healthy eating, demonstrating superfast, tasty recipes and short, intense work-outs. Among those hoping to be transformed are a fireman who has struggled with fighting the flab, a police officer who worries her colleagues use the word bubbly as code for fat and a couple who want to lose weight for their honeymoon.(n)

programme.title: Make My Body Better with Davina McCall
programme.desc: This edition focuses on 32st teaching assistant James, who finds a simple walk along the street a feat of endurance and the 27-year-old's health and life are at risk. programme.title: D-Day's Sunken Secrets
programme.desc: Using two mini-submarines, a group of historians, wreck detectives, scientists and D-Day veterans go on an expedition to search the seabed for items from the Normandy landings of June 1944. Among the objects the team finds are a collection of American Sherman tanks that were specially adapted to float, and the wreck of the SS Leopoldville, a troopship sunk by a U-boat in December 1944 with the loss of more than 800 lives. Richard Armitage narrates.(n)

programme.title: Adolf and Eva: Love and War
programme.desc: Drama-documentary about Eva Braun, from her teenage infatuation with Adolf Hitler to their wedding and joint suicide in a Berlin bunker, exposes the power she wielded over the increasingly delusional fascist dictator. The film combines her home movies, with archive clips, dramatic reconstructions and interviews with the leading experts on the Nazi inner circle to reveal why she fell for a man like Hitler and just how much she knew about the murderous activities of the Nazi Party.(n)

programme.title: Schindler's List

Steven Spielberg's Oscar-winning drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley and Ralph Fiennes.(n)

Mitch hides important news from Cam, and Andy and Haley finally come to a realisation about their feelings for each other.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross Kemp visits the Central American republic of Honduras, where he makes his way to the city of San Pedro Sula. With a rate of 169 homicides per 100,000 inhabitants last year - an average of more than three people each day - Sula has the dubious distinction of being the most dangerous city on the planet outside of a war zone. Ross discovers how armed drug gangs have taken over many parts of the country, forcing thousands to flee north on a freight train that transports migrants through Guatemala and across Mexico into the United States. But it's an arduous journey and not for the faint-hearted. Even if passengers avoid falling off the roof of the train to their deaths, they face being robbed by bandits, raped, murdered or kidnapped and sold into slavery.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride

The prospective groom has just three weeks to organise the event and his bride-to-be can only hope they are on the same page and that she gets the wedding of her dreams.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Holly is hoping for a warm, cosy family wedding, but her cowboy-loving fiance Cole has a Wild West theme in mind and has three weeks to plan the occasion.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Kloe dreams of a romantic ceremony on a Mediterranean beach, but her fiance Lawrence has his sights set on a funfair-themed day and she has agreed to hand over total control of the wedding to her other half.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart has the bright idea of taking out a credit card in Santa's Little Helper's name and orders a fully trained pedigree collie. Unfortunately, he has trouble keeping up the payments and soon receives a visit from bailiffs wanting to repossess all his purchases.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Old Man and the Lisa.
programme.desc: Lisa takes pity on a bankrupt Mr Burns and encourages him to build a recycling centre, hoping it will get him back on his feet - but makes the mistake of underestimating his ruthlessness. Featuring the guest voice of wrestler Bret Hart.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge begins work as a church volunteer and restores Reverend Lovejoy's faith in his vocation, while Homer is baffled to discover his image printed on a box of Japanese washing powder.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns hires a hard-working, conscientious new employee, who takes an instant dislike to the slobbish Homer and sets about trying to humiliate him. Meanwhile, Bart buys an abandoned factory for a dollar at a government auction and gives Milhouse the job of nightwatchman.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Troy McClure hosts three spin-off segments, transplanting characters from the show into new situations and locations, including Chief Wiggum's attempt to make his name as a private investigator, ably assisted by streetwise sidekick Principal Skinner, alias `Skinny Boy'.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Secret War of Lisa Simpson.
programme.desc: Homer and Marge force Bart to enrol in a military academy and Lisa unwisely follows him. Once in her own barracks she is snubbed by the other cadets - but receives unexpected help from Bart to tackle the assault course. Featuring the guest voice of Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is fired from the power plant and becomes so dejected that he contemplates suicide - until a near-tragic road accident makes him realise his purpose in life is to make Springfield safer.(n)

programme.title: Futurama

programme.title: Futurama

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A mysterious cat burglar ransacks the Simpson household, making off with Lisa's saxophone. Homer becomes the leader of a neighbourhood watch scheme to find the miscreant - but soon lets the power go to his head. Featuring the guest voice of Sam Neill.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart lands a job as assistant to his idol Krusty the Clown and even gets to say his own catchphrase in front of the cameras, winning instant celebrity status. Featuring the guest voice of TV host Conan O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer finds himself being rushed to hospital suffering from food poisoning as a consequence of Apu's misconduct at the Kwik-E-Mart. Featuring the guest voice of James Woods.(n)

programme.desc: A crisis at the BAU triggers the return of Emily Prentiss (Paget Brewster) as the crime drama marks its 200th episode. programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team hunts a crazed couple who are murdering women in Pittsburgh, while Garcia and Morgan try to keep the spark alive in their respective relationships on Valentine's Day, but Garcia grows increasingly concerned that she and Sam have different ideas about their future together.(n)

programme.desc: Jane and Weller are sent to a remote town to capture a dangerous criminal, who turns out to have a connection with Mayfair. Patterson breaks the rules to solve a puzzle.(n)

programme.desc: Captain Gregson reveals details about his private life when his home is invaded by a masked gunman. Although his wife Cheryl is shaken by the ordeal, Sherlock does not assume she is innocent. Jonny Lee Miller and Lucy Liu star.(n)

programme.title: Madam Secretary
programme.desc: A plane carrying the Moldovan prime minister and one of Elizabeth's former CIA colleagues vanishes, while Henry's NSA work places him in grave danger.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth tries to find out whether a young lupus patient's use of medical marijuana and a job at a drug dispensary could be linked to her murder, and away from the case, he's determined to excel in the FBI competency test, but Brennan worries he has prioritised the physical aspect of the exam over the intellectual side of it. Meanwhile, Wendell updates the team on his cancer treatment, but makes an indiscretion that could get him fired.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan re-evaluates her relationship with Booth when Afghanistan war correspondent Hannah Burley pays him a surprise visit, and the duo try to piece together the identities of two people from remains found in a cave. Guest starring Katheryn Winnick (Failure to Launch).(n)

programme.desc: Alex has to choose which of two newborn twins gets a liver transplant. April and Jackson's marriage hits a new low and Maggie receives an invitation to her ex's wedding.(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: An elderly patient encourages Arizona not to give up on romance, Maggie and Andrew deal with the aftermath of their hook-up and Owen gives the interns a lesson in breaking bad news.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The police are suspicious of a man who is wearing two pairs of trousers and two jackets, and they listen in amusement to his feeble attempts at a credible explanation. Plus, two car thieves wearing washing-up gloves make a swift getaway, but are halted when they collide with a cameraman.(n)

programme.title: Who'd Be a Billionaire
programme.desc: Documentary exposing outrageous stories of excess and expense in the world of the super-rich, with the first episode exploring three status-defining toys every billionaire must have - a private jet, a collection of supercars and a mega-yacht.(n)

programme.title: Who'd Be a Billionaire
programme.desc: A peek inside the mansions of the super-rich, complete with concierge services, ice rooms and sushi bars.(n)

programme.title: Who'd Be a Billionaire
programme.desc: A look at the wide range of people employed by today's billionaires to provide for their every whim, from butlers and nutritionists to florists and art consultants.(n)

programme.title: Who'd Be a Billionaire
programme.desc: A look at the spending habits of the richest people in the world, taking in extravagant purchases including gold-plated cots, trips to the Arctic and a million-dollar vacuum cleaner.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Gideon faces his biggest challenge yet when he tries to persuade a cornered sadistic murderer to reveal the location of a woman he has abducted. Starring Mandy Patinkin and Thomas Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The investigation into a series of deaths near construction sites and abandoned homes leads the team to suspect a homeless man of the crimes. Meanwhile, Reid's apparent behavioural changes become a cause for concern. Starring Matthew Gray Gubler.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Several family homes are set on fire by an environmental activist, leading the BAU to discover a connection between the targeted properties and a number of corporate companies accused of building on contaminated land. Drama following the work of FBI agents, starring Mandy Patinkin.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A serial killer reappears after 20 years of inactivity and contacts the Behavioural Analysis Unit through Gideon's retired mentor - and the chase to find him heats up when he threatens to strike again within the next five days. Drama, starring Mandy Patinkin.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The mutilated bodies of five students are found in an unoccupied house in New Mexico. The Behavioural Analysis Unit suspects the involvement of a cult with knowledge of Native American rituals - a hypothesis seemingly confirmed by the discovery that the murder scene stands on the site of an old Apache burial ground. Drama, starring Matthew Gray Gubler.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team travels to New York City to investigate a series of murders apparently committed by a vigilante exacting revenge on acquitted former convicts. Drama, starring Thomas Gibson, AJ Cook, Matthew Gray Gubler and Mandy Patinkin.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Reid helps to conduct a training seminar for the LAPD in California, where he becomes attracted to a TV starlet who is being stalked by a killer linked to several recent showbiz murders, including the death of a producer. Drama, starring Matthew Gray Gubler, Mandy Patinkin and Thomas Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: An Italian tourist is questioned about his travel documents by officials, an American couple argue with quarantine officers in Melbourne and a passenger's anxious behaviour arouses suspicion.(n)

programme.title: Cooks to Market
programme.desc: The culinary competition continues as two teams attempt to transform the takeaway market. Given just £250 and a few hours, the rivals make original soup and cheesecake products on a commercial scale and sell them at one of London's busiest shopping centres. The duo who make the greater profit then pitch their creation to a board of investors in a bid to become a household brand. Presented by Gizzi Erskine and James Averdieck.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen Rules: Australia
programme.desc: In the sixth People's Choice challenge, the remaining teams must prepare a meal to be featured in Coles Magazine.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU officers pursue a serial killer whose trademark is covering victims in scratches. Investigations reveal the murders are probably being committed by someone suffering from an obsessive skin disorder, but little more can be gleaned. As further victims bearing the same claw marks are found, the team has to determine a way of quickly bringing down the perpetrator. Alicia Coppola guest stars, with David Rossi and Derek Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents try to get inside the mind of a kidnapper in Phoenix who is depriving his victims of sleep, while Hotch and Garcia investigate a threat made by an underground group calling themselves the Dirty Dozen. Crime drama, starring Joe Mantegna.(n)

programme.title: Shades of Blue
programme.desc: With Saperstein's life hanging in the balance, Harlee struggles to protect him from Wozniak, who is torn between his conscience and a need to finish the job. Jennifer Lopez stars.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Jason Gideon embarks on his first investigation with the FBI's Behavioral Analysis Unit since suffering a breakdown, as he and the team look into the disappearance of four Seattle women in as many months. The agents find a likely suspect, but realise he has an accomplice. First episode of the crime drama, starring Mandy Patinkin.(n)

programme.title: The Petrol Age
programme.desc: Paul McGann explores how British luxury car manufacturers became internationally renowned as leaders in their field. He profiles engineers and designers including Charles Rolls and Henry Royce, discovers why 1950s socialite Lady Docker developed a fascination with Daimlers, and drives a selection of the models that helped establish Bentley as one of the world's most sought-after marques.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Stand-alone episode of the political drama, specially penned by creator Aaron Sorkin in response to the attacks on America on September 11. Students visiting the White House are caught up in a security alert involving suspected Islamic extremists.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part one of two. President Bartlet announces his desire to run for re-election, throwing his staff into disarray as they try to write his speech and leaving First Lady Abby fuming over not being consulted. CJ makes a crucial gaffe during a press conference and the president has to decide whether to send in the military to rescue the staff of a besieged US embassy.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team go into overdrive as the President prepares to make his re-election announcement and the staff are left wondering if he will apologise for disclosing his MS. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: A special prosecutor investigates President Bartlet's non-disclosure of his illness, and subsequently issues subpoenas to the White House staff. Meanwhile, a forest fire in Wyoming causes contention and Donna goes on a blind date with a charming Republican. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet attempts to veto a controversial new `death tax' bill supported by the House of Representatives, putting his hard-pressed staff well and truly on the spot. Josh tries to influence Governor Buckland, CJ rebukes Sherri and Charlie is advised to ask for immunity in his forthcoming testimony. Anna Deavere Smith guest stars.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist turns his attention to creatures that dominate the skies today. He begins with the vast bird family, watching a group of vultures as they go scavenging and some peregrine falcons dive bombing for their prey. He then moves on to the floating forests of Ecuador to find out what makes the humble hummingbird tick, before ending his journey at the Gomantong bat caves of Borneo - a place he first filmed in 1972 - witnessing a mass exodus of the creatures. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The squad examines the case of an investigative journalist who disappeared while working on a story about water pollution. They discover he was last seen with his ex-girlfriend, who belongs to a radical environmentalist group, but it also emerges his news stories have made him plenty of enemies. Anthony LaPaglia stars.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team search for a missing criminal defence attorney whose disappearance may be the result of a gradual slide into paranoid schizophrenia. Jerry O'Connell guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team looks into the case of a kidnapped motivational speaker and finds multiple suspects, including a man who seems to be hiding a secret. Starring Anthony LaPaglia, with guest star Jay Harrington.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A former policewoman, now employed as a bounty hunter, is shot and subsequently vanishes, leading Jack and the team into an intriguing mystery. Crime drama, starring Anthony LaPaglia, Poppy Montgomery and Marianne Jean-Baptiste.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Construction workers find a decomposed body on a building site, and Rush reopens the case of a grocery clerk who went missing in 1984, when his ambition to become a dancer brought him more enemies than friends.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: When the body of a homeless woman is found with gunshot wounds at the bottom of a lake, the team is prompted to reopen a murder case from 1999. Rush and her group of investigators track down the victim's estranged daughters in an attempt to piece together enough information to uncover the killer.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: An anonymous confession discovered at an art exhibition leads Rush to take the team undercover to a high school to re-examine the 1997 murder of a 16-year-old cheerleader.(n)

programme.title: Band of Brothers
programme.desc: Easy Company makes the grim discovery of a concentration camp when the soldiers finally enter Germany. As the local citizens - who claim they were ignorant of its existence - are forced into a clean-up operation, news arrives that Hitler has committed suicide. Damian Lewis and Donnie Wahlberg star.(n)

programme.title: Band of Brothers
programme.desc: Easy Company overruns Hitler's Bavarian fortress retreat and the privates compare points to see who will be returning home as they nervously await news of their impending deployment to the Pacific. Starring Damian Lewis and Donnie Wahlberg. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Ray turns to an old opponent in his quest to get Mickey out of prison and has an unexpected confrontation with a slick Hollywood agent and a former fixer of Ezra's.(n)

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.sub-title: The Knight in White Satin Armour.
programme.desc: Pussy's loyalty to the Mob wavers and Tony's mistress puts pressure on him to continue their affair, while a domestic quarrel between Janice and Richie has a decidedly deadly outcome. James Gandolfini stars.(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: President Meyer and her staff are on the back foot when a junior member of the team hacks medical and social security records to support the Families First bill.(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Selina welcomes a US journalist out of captivity in Iran, and adds a sycophantic new member to the team, while Dan lines up a potential new job opportunity.(n)

programme.title: Veep

programme.desc: Paul McGann explores how British luxury car manufacturers became internationally renowned as leaders in their field. Meanwhile, Sir Benjamin Slade hopes a murder mystery weekend at Maunsel House in Somerset will help pay off a sizeable electricity bill.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team investigates after the body of a former star jockey reported missing in 1986 is found in a mass grave for horses. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris, Danny Pino and John Finn.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The files are reopened on the unsolved 1991 case of a 14-year-old girl who was murdered months after she was placed with new foster parents and had started establishing herself as a gifted rapper within the local hip-hop community.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet attempts to veto a controversial new `death tax' bill supported by the House of Representatives, putting his hard-pressed staff well and truly on the spot. Josh tries to influence Governor Buckland, CJ rebukes Sherri and Charlie is advised to ask for immunity in his forthcoming testimony. Anna Deavere Smith guest stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A mobster who fell into a coma moments before testifying in court is brought in for treatment, but his brother begs House to keep him in hospital to stop him taking the stand. The grumpy medic soon has cause for concern when it transpires the gangster has been poisoned.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack, Samantha and Danny try to track down a gunman who has shot Martin during an ambush and left him in a critical condition - but interference by senior FBI officials complicates the task. With Anthony LaPaglia and Eric Close.(n)
