programme.title: Movies Now
programme.desc: The latest cinema news, reviews and interviews with the stars.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: A stock market windfall gives Lucia the opportunity to embark on a round of charitable spending, which leads to her being invited to take a place on the town council. Meanwhile, another flood at Grebe forces Mapp and Major Benjy to seek refuge at Mallards. Geraldine McEwan and Prunella Scales star.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.sub-title: A Case of Coincidence - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. A girl's body is found in the fens and the investigation takes a complicated turn for Inspector Masters as more fatalities are reported. Keith Barron, Ronald Pickup, Caroline Bliss and Don Henderson star.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.sub-title: A Case of Coincidence - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Eddie Brannel's protests of innocence urge Masters to go against orders, and as a consequence he learns the true identity of the killer. Drama, with Keith Barron and Ronald Pickup.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Stafford becomes Head of Europol, but the position gives him plenty of free time, so the Home Office ask him to tackle corruption within the Metropolitan Police Force.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Happiest Days of Your Life - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Primrose falls for a roofing contractor, while the twins prove too much of a handful for their school, prompting a trip to view the facilities on offer at Brockhurst College. Nostalgic comedy drama, starring David Jason and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A single mother from Sunderland asks Kavanagh to prosecute the neighbourhood vigilante she suspects of attempting to murder her teenage tearaway son in a hit-and-run incident. At first he has misgivings about accepting a case so far from home, but finally agrees - only to find his already strained family life suffering as a result. Tense legal drama, starring John Thaw and Lisa Harrow, with a guest appearance by Robert Glenister.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl takes an overdose and Blaketon's mysterious private life comes to light when his car goes missing and is involved in an accident. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike joins forces with Scotland Yard when a gang of thieves turns up in Aidensfield, apparently plotting to steal a valuable horse from local trainer Kieron Doyle. The heroic copper doggedly pursues his quarry to the detriment of his relationship with Tricia - but tragedy strikes, leaving him heartbroken.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective's friend Sir Charles Cartwright (guest star Martin Shaw) hosts a cocktail party at his home in Cornwall, where an amiable local priest chokes to death on his drink. There seems to be no motive for murder, and no trace of poison found in the victim's glass, but weeks later, when Sir Charles's doctor friend Sir Bartholomew Strange dies in similar circumstances, he and Poirot team up to investigate. Drama, with Art Malik, Jane Asher and Anna Carteret, and David Suchet in the title role.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An actress engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The pipe-smoking sleuth is forced to take drastic measures to trap a serial killer terrorising the women of Montmartre, employing a policewoman as a decoy. Drama starring Michael Gambon, with Ciaran Madden and Geoffrey Hutchings.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel is criticised for a lack of progress with the investigation and she knows she must find both a murder weapon and the encryption code used to access the website. However, as the team makes a significant breakthrough in the case, DSI Julie Dodson makes a discovery which jeopardises Rachel's position as Acting DI. Meanwhile, when Janet's attempt to help Taisie results in a complaint, her faith in justice is tested, and both Scott and Bailey have life-changing decisions to make about their futures. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Black Work
programme.desc: Jo is left reeling as the secrets she has uncovered prove devastating for her family. She decides to abandon her investigation into Ryan's death out of fear she is endangering her children. However, when another body is discovered, she realises that her husband's murderer is still at large, and it is up to her to see that he is brought to justice. But as she takes up the case again, she does not realise that the killer could be terrifyingly close to home. Conclusion of the three-part crime drama, starring Sheridan Smith. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A well-known eccentric contacts the Belgian sleuth when he is haunted by suicidal nightmares. However, he fails to follow Poirot's advice, and is found dead soon afterwards. Drama, starring David Suchet, with Joely Richardson and Mary Tamm.(n)

programme.title: The Guilty
programme.desc: Maggie has no choice but to charge her prime suspect when he reveals information only the killer could have known, but she's not convinced he is the culprit. A brutal death then seems to close the case for good and the detective faces a tough decision. Will she protect her career or expose the truth? Meanwhile, Claire and Daniel's marriage is pushed to breaking point by the return of their neighbour Teresa, and the reappearance of an old face leaves Luke shaken. Crime drama set across two timelines, starring Tamsin Greig, Katherine Kelly and Darren Boyd.(n)

programme.title: Band of Gold
programme.desc: Gina's murder leaves her friends in a predicament, and Carol lures the suspected killer to her bedroom. Powerful drama, starring Cathy Tyson and Geraldine James.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: When the Mayor retires, Lucia is invited to stand for election on the Tilling council - giving her a taste for power. Prunella Scales stars.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: Georgie is wooed by eccentric aristocrat the Duchess of Sheffield, who mistakes him for the mayor of Tilling, and Quaint Irene's portrait of Mapp appears in all the newspapers. Prunella Scales and Nigel Hawthorne star.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Stafford becomes Head of Europol, but the position gives him plenty of free time, so the Home Office ask him to tackle corruption within the Metropolitan Police Force.(n)

programme.title: Movies Now
programme.desc: The latest cinema news, reviews and interviews with the stars.(n)

programme.title: Drama Trails
programme.desc: The connections between TV dramas, narrated by James Nesbitt.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robert of Huntingdon assumes the mantle of Robin Hood as the re-formed band of outlaws resolves to rescue Marion from Clun. Fantasy drama, starring Jason Connery, with Ray Winstone, Judi Trott and Phil Davis.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack congratulates himself on having got the better of Robert in the run-up to the risk-management inquiry, but just when everything seems to be going his way, he goes and causes a road accident . To make matters worse, he's been banned from driving, and shouldn't have been behind the wheel of a car in the first place, which understandably makes it hard for him to keep his mind on his job. Worried and distracted, he makes a grave error of judgement, and suddenly finds himself struggling to cover his tracks. Meanwhile, Sam finds herself on the receiving end of Christine's wrath over a malicious rumour. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack, with a guest appearance by Jane Danson's real-life partner Robert Beck.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.sub-title: A Case of Coincidence - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Eddie Brannel's protests of innocence urge Masters to go against orders, and as a consequence he learns the true identity of the killer. Drama, with Keith Barron and Ronald Pickup.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The police think an elderly woman is dreaming when she claims someone is moving her belongings, but then she is found murdered and Maigret is called in to investigate. Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress investigates missing golf balls, and some lads break into a local war hero's home. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Two boys kill a police officer and no one wants to give any information about the murderers - until Stafford comes up with a deal for better policing on the estate.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Darling Buds of May - Part One.
programme.desc: The first episode of the whimsical rural drama based on HE Bates' novels. Tax collector Cedric Charlton visits the Larkin household intent on getting the head of the family - Pop - to correctly fill out his tax forms. In so doing he falls for attractive daughter Mariette. Starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Robert is badly wounded in a raid, so the men send for Marian, while the Sheriff of Nottingham tries to prove the identity of the outlaws' leader.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The new sergeant's arrival could mean radical changes for Greengrass, and everyone is under suspicion when a girl reports a stalker in the village.(n)

programme.title: My Uncle Silas
programme.desc: Edward looks forward to spending his holidays with his uncle and attending his cousin's wedding. Later the two redecorate a hotel, and the owner's wife makes quite an impression. Double bill of the drama based on the tales by HE Bates, starring Albert Finney, Joe Prospero, and Sue Johnston.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The pipe-smoking detective returns to his home town to investigate an anonymous warning that a crime is about to be committed in St Fiacre's Church. Detective series, starring Michael Gambon.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Captain Hastings is staying with friends when wealthy heiress Mrs Inglethorp is murdered. He calls in Hercule Poirot to help him solve the baffling crime, which has the whole household under suspicion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth, with Hugh Fraser, Pauline Moran, Anthony Calf and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith takes the lead role in Jeff Pope's three-part drama charting Cilla Black's rise to fame in the 1960s. As the series opens, Priscilla White is a Liverpool typist with dreams of escaping the office and becoming a singer. It looks like her chance has come when she meets songwriter Bobby Willis, who claims to be in the music industry - so she's less than impressed to later discover his flash car is hired and he actually works in a bakery. Despite this inauspicious start, Cilla agrees to let him manage her, but will their arrangement still stand after her friends, a local band by the name of the Beatles, help her land an audition with genuine impresario Brian Epstein? Aneurin Barnard, Ed Stoppard and John Henshaw also star.(n)

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Reunited with Bobby, Cilla's confidence returns and she once again dazzles crowds with her vocal talents. The re-emergence of impresario Brian Epstein then propels her career to greater heights, but this is quickly followed by a new low when her first record fails to set the charts alight, despite being written by two local lads called John Lennon and Paul McCartney. Epstein suggests a change of direction, persuading the singer to take a gamble on the ballad Anyone Who Had a Heart, against her future husband's advice. Continuing Jeff Pope's three-part biopic charting Cilla Black's rise to fame in 1960s Liverpool, starring Sheridan Smith, with Aneurin Barnard and Ed Stoppard.(n)

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: It looks like Cilla has put that early botched audition and those disappointing record sales behind her as, following the success of Anyone Who Had a Heart, her new single You're My World becomes her second number one. However, while she may have conquered the UK charts, can she follow in the footsteps of her old mates the Beatles and crack America? The signs aren't looking good, and just to add to the pressure, her relationship with Bobby is becoming increasingly tumultuous. But as her manager Brian Epstein's private life starts to spiral out of control, it seems there could be an even bigger threat to Cilla's new-found success. The concluding instalment of Jeff Pope's biopic charting Cilla Black's rise to fame, starring Sheridan Smith, Aneurin Barnard and Ed Stoppard.(n)

programme.title: Game of Crowns
programme.desc: Shelley and Susanna Paliotta arrive with their daughters for a party in Lynne's brand new tea salon. Susanna invites everyone to a fashion show that Isabella will be headlining and performing her `hit' song LOL. Series following the exploits of six pageant wives whose lives revolve around glamour, perfection and winning at any cost.(n)

programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, former Made in Chelsea star Ashley James chooses three men to date based on the menus she most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again.(n)

programme.title: I Dream of NeNe
programme.sub-title: I Dream of NeNe: The Wedding: Patch the Leakes.
programme.desc: NeNe and Gregg Leakes are supposed to be planning their wedding, but get sidelined by past issues. The bridesmaids reveal that they are holding grudges over who is being picked for the bridal party, while the couple haven't spoken since their tense pre-marital counselling session. The Real Housewives of Atlanta star visits her friend Donald Trump for some advice of getting a pre-nup and dealing with step-families, before she confronts her fiance over his five children.(n)

programme.desc: Ramona urges Kelly to resolve her differences with Bethenny, but when the pair meet at a bar to make amends, they end up arguing again. programme.desc: Jill invites her friends over to appreciate the flat's re-design, and her partner has to pull out of playing in her tennis match against Ramona and Mario, so Bethenny suggests she ask Simon to play in his place - a decision that could upset Ramona.(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of New York City
programme.desc: Ramona decides to develop her skincare products, LuAnn meets up with her writer to finish the book and Bethenny actively promotes her baked goods line.(n)

programme.title: Little Dorrit Part Two: Little Dorrit's Story
programme.desc: A seamstress is born into poverty, and spends her life striving to support her imprisoned father and selfish family. An encounter with a man recently returned from overseas offers a chance of salvation. Conclusion of the two-part adaptation of Charles Dickens' novel telling the story from the title character's point of view, starring Sarah Pickering, Derek Jacobi, Alec Guinness and Joan Greenwood.(n)

programme.title: QPR: The Four Year Plan
programme.desc: An insight into the running of Queens Park Rangers football club in recent years, as cameras were given unprecedented access to the boardroom and the first team. In 2007, the club was facing relegation from the Championship as well as financial ruin, before being bought by F1 supremo Bernie Ecclestone and Italian businessman Flavio Briatore. Soon after, they were joined on the board by Indian steel magnate Lakshmi Mittal, and together the new owners promised a return to glory for the club and its supporters.(n)

programme.title: Inside MI5: The Real Spooks
programme.desc: The history of the domestic security service, based on the book Defence of the Realm by historian Christopher Andrew, who was given unprecedented access to MI5's top-secret files. The film includes interviews with a past director-general of the agency and a former head of the Met's anti-terrorism branch, and investigates the alleged plot against Harold Wilson. It also reviews allegations that one-time MI5 boss Roger Hollis and trade union leader Jack Jones were Soviet agents and that the killing of three IRA terrorists in Gibraltar was evidence of a shoot-to-kill policy by the organisation.(n)

programme.title: Enigma
programme.desc: At Bletchley Park, a brilliant mathematician races against time to crack the latest cipher used by Germany to send encoded messages through its Enigma machine. During the assignment, he falls for a female colleague, but later fears he may have been confiding in a traitor to the Allied cause. Second World War romantic thriller, based on the bestseller by Robert Harris, with Dougray Scott, Saffron Burrows and Kate Winslet.(n)

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: A Rastafarian garage mechanic in a tough London neighbourhood heads up a mobile DJ crew and prepares to compete in a sound-systems competition. However, he has to contend with racism, violence and crime, and his life begins to unravel as he loses his job, is harassed by the police under stop-and-search laws and has his equipment destroyed by angry neighbours. Drama, with Brinsley Forde and Karl Howman.(n)

programme.title: Essex Boys: Retribution
programme.desc: The aftermath of the notorious murder of three successful drug dealers proves to have far-reaching consequences. Years later, ambitious young criminals look to make their own mark on the underworld, while others seek revenge for the killing, setting in motion a brutal cycle of gangland violence. Crime drama sequel, starring Alex Esmail and Ian Virgo.(n)

programme.title: Noel Fielding's Luxury Comedy
programme.desc: Noel discovers Andy Warhol is a fake, Tony Reason is visited by an old friend, and the jungle is terrorised by a giant tiger with an STD. A mix of live action and animated comedy, featuring music by Kasabian's Sergio Pizzorno.(n)

programme.title: Drop the Dead Donkey
programme.desc: George considers going to Australia with Sue, Henry quits his late-night show, Joy learns her art may not be as valuable as first thought, and Gus meets Sir Position in person.(n)

programme.title: Desmond's
programme.desc: A funky American preacher sues Desmond for a cut he had two years ago, not to mention the two years of mental distress he suffered as a result.(n)

programme.title: Desmond's
programme.desc: An old flame of Porkpie's turns up out of the blue while his fiancee is away. Barbershop comedy, starring Norman Beaton.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. Included are the epic journeys of sperm whales from one side of the ocean to the other in search of food and a mate, the thriving species that inhabit New Zealand's coast, and the tropical penguins and sea lions supported by the Galapagos Islands.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Girl Who Talked to Dolphins
programme.desc: Documentary exploring an attempt to teach a dolphin to understand English. In the 1960s, a scientist flooded a house and invited a young woman to live there full time with the animal in the hope that the creature would be able to communicate with her. Featuring contributions from those involved in the experiment, who are speaking about events for the first time.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.(n)

programme.title: The Re-Inventors
programme.desc: The crew tests an eco-friendly 1980s solar crematorium, aiming to make an impact on environmental pollution one funeral at a time.(n)

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Descendants of Egyptologist Arthur Weigall, aristocrat George Herbert and scientist Alfred Lucas learn the significant roles their ancestors played in the discovery of Tutankhamun's tomb. Presented by Chris Hollins.(n)

programme.title: Battle of Britain
programme.desc: Actor Ewan McGregor and his RAF pilot brother Colin look back on the pivotal Second World War battle, and meet brave souls who helped repel the Nazi Luftwaffe's relentless attacks.(n)

programme.title: Wild Brazil
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan narrates a documentary following capuchin monkeys, giant otters and coatis as they strive to raise their families. The first episode sees the young animals taking their first steps in some of the world's most extraordinary habitats, where they have to beware of deadly predators including the jaguar and caiman.(n)

programme.title: Wild Brazil
programme.desc: The animal families face the formidable monsoon rains and the giant otter cubs must watch out for predatory jaguars and learn to swim before their river floods. The coatis have to eat as much as they can ahead of their habitat disappearing underwater, while the youngest capuchin monkey needs to master some clever survival skills. Stephen Mangan narrates.(n)

programme.title: Wild Brazil
programme.desc: A fierce drought culminates in huge and ferocious fires, and the capuchin monkeys, giant otters and coatis must use their survival skills to endure the extreme conditions. The animals are also looking for mates so they can breed in time to ensure the next generation are born at the optimal moment.(n)

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective.(n)

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower.(n)

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Michael begins the third leg of his journey in the mineral-rich state of Minas Gerais, where he learns about the Brazilian mining industry and meets some of the people dedicated to overturning the environmental damage it causes. He then heads to Rio de Janeiro, focus of the next Olympics, where the authorities are ridding the streets of violent drug gangs that have controlled the city's shanty towns. On a lighter note, the globe-trotting broadcaster also learns to celebrate a goal like a well-known radio commentator and visits a `love hotel'.(n)

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey across the South American country, Michael explores the Brazilian south, where he is surprised by the rich diversity of European and Asian influences. Along the way he meets Dom Joao de Orleans e Braganca, second in line of succession to Brazil's defunct throne, goes flying with a man who has made a fortune out of rubbish and meets rap star Criolo, who believes social equality is a distant dream for most of his countrymen. Travelling farther south to Blumenau, the former Python's views on what makes a typical Brazilian are challenged when he finds German speakers and Bavarian dancers, before he catches piranha for sushi and helps cowboys treat a calf attacked by a jaguar.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the ants of Manaus, Brazil. Several species of the thriving insect cover the urban jungle, but it is the leafcutters that rule.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the many reptiles of Manaus, Brazil. The city employs specialists to manage the cold-blooded creatures.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the most unusual animals that live in the city of Manaus, Brazil, such as rodents, birds, and the intriguing white-faced saki.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the smallest animals that live in the jungle city of Manaus, Brazil, including spiders, scorpions and mosquitoes.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the waterways of Manaus. People share the Rio Negro with exotic animals and tropical fish - one of which, the pirarucu - can reach lengths of three metres.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary following the wildlife experts of Manaus, Brazil, who respond to call outs from across the jungle city related to an array of species.(n)

programme.title: The Treasures of Ancient Rome
programme.desc: Alastair Sooke reveals how the Romans' obsession with sex and violence was reflected in their art, and dons a wetsuit to visit the remains of emperor Claudius's pleasure palace. He also examines the bombastic pieces the Republic has become renowned for, including monumental arches and columns whose imagery relays the story of glorious military victories. Plus, the story of the emperor Hadrian, who redesigned the Pantheon in Rome.(n)

programme.desc: Actor Ewan McGregor and his RAF pilot brother Colin look back on the pivotal Second World War battle, and meet brave souls who helped repel the Nazi Luftwaffe's relentless attacks.(n)

programme.title: Britain in Motion
programme.desc: Russ Malkin explores the manufacture of British utility vehicles. Plus, he investigates the history of manufacturing the vehicles and what the future holds.(n)

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Three members of the public find out how they are related to key individuals who helped Admiral Nelson in his defeat of Napoleon's fleet at Trafalgar in October 1805. Presented by Chris Hollins.(n)

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Lucy Scott, explorer Robert Falcon Scott's great-granddaughter, learns about the appalling conditions her ancestor would have faced in the Antarctic during the winter of 1912 during his bid to become the first man to reach the South Pole. Presented by Chris Hollins.(n)

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: The descendants of three soldiers who served during the First World War learn about their relatives' roles in the Christmas truce of 1914. Presented by Chrs Hollins.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary studying the animal life of Manaus, Brazil. Timid pied tamarins struggle to find food in the urban jungle, while confident squirrel monkeys roam in gangs.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Documentary examining sloths in Manaus. Wildlife experts must find out why the slow-moving creatures are swapping their jungle homes for the city streets before any get hurt.(n)

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Manaus
programme.desc: Observing the dolphins and manatees that inhabit the rivers around Manaus. While the former have adapted to human fishing habits, the latter are struggling to survive.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary studying the wild cats that frequently head into Manaus. The jungle city's wildlife experts must come to the rescue when jaguars, pumas, ocelots and margays are spotted.(n)

programme.desc: A look at the vultures that flock to Manaus, and how an increase in collisions with planes means that specialists must find out what is drawing them into the city.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary studying caimans in Manaus, Brazil. One causes panic after it is spotted on a popular beach, and expert Dr Ronis Da Silveira is called in to investigate.(n)

programme.title: The Treasures of Ancient Rome
programme.desc: Alastair Sooke charts the decline and fall of the Roman Empire through some of its hidden and most magical artistic treasures. On a trip to Leptis Magna in Libya, shortly after the overthrow of Colonel Gaddafi, he finds one of the best preserved Roman cities in the world and the cradle of later Roman art. Sooke discovers glorious mosaics that have never been filmed before, but also finds evidence of shocking neglect of Libya's Roman heritage under the Gaddafi regime.(n)

programme.title: Cyw

programme.title: Darwin, y Cymro a'r Cynllwyn
programme.desc: Documentary exploring claims that Charles Darwin may have used deception to be recognised as the person who developed the Theory of Evolution. New research from the Cambridge archives suggests that Darwin could have lied about the dates of letters he received from a young beetle collector, Alfred Russel Wallace.(n)

programme.title: Cofio
programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic television moments with Sue Roderick, in conversation with Heledd Cynwal. As a child, Sue was a singer, and part of the duo 'Treflyn and Siwsann'.(n)

programme.title: Dal Ati
programme.desc: Nia Parry visits Montgomeryshire and speaks to local people along the way.(n)

programme.title: Dal Ati
programme.desc: Nia Parry visits the home of sportswoman, commentator and personal trainer Non Evans, and Craig ab Iago explores the history of the family at Ysbyty Ifan Farm.(n)

programme.title: Cegin Bryn
programme.desc: Bryn Williams cooks honey and mustard roast ham, recreates a classic pavlova with home-made lemon curd and fresh raspberries, and prepares super fresh oysters with lime and ginger.(n)

programme.title: Cegin Bryn

programme.title: Cegin Bryn

Elen Pencwm presents both the Welsh and Open Championships as well as the Wales v New Zealand Test series.(n)

programme.title: Gohebwyr: Jon Gower
programme.desc: The story of missionary Robert Jermain Thomas who, despite being little known in Wales, is hailed as a hero in South Korea. programme.title: Gwlad Beirdd
programme.desc: Melin Trefin yw cerdd enwoca' Crwys ac yn y rhaglen hon bydd Tudur Dylan Jones a Mererid Hopwood yn ymweld a phentref Trefin ac yn cyflwyno'r gerdd yn yr adfail. Y ddwy gerdd arall sydd yn cael eu cynnwys yw Gweddill ac Y Garreg Filltir. programme.desc: While transporting the corpse of Lt Gordon Roth to the morgue, a flat tyre brings Ducky and Jimmy to a halt and they are abducted and taken to a remote cabin - where one of their captors wants the post-mortem to take place. Guest starring Valerie Cruz (The Following).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is stabbed to death after stepping out of her shower, becoming the latest victim of the Dead Rose Slasher. Gibbs is approached by his old friend and barber Frankie Dean, who shares his concern that his son Cameron may be the killer. He explains that a photo-fit released to the media resembles him, and the attacks stopped during a period coinciding with his three-year stint in the navy. Meanwhile, Tony has to take probationary agent Ned Dorneget under his wing.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Marine sergeant Teddy Lemere is killed by a sniper in Afghanistan just after his sniffer dog helps guide a young child out of a minefield. Back in the US, his widow Ruby tells Gibbs and the team that she had recently received a message from her husband saying he might have upset a few people. Abby retrieves a tiny shard of the sniper's bullet from Ted's helmet and finds that it was made in America.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A doctor dies on board the USS Borealis during a heavy storm and when the ship is brought into Norfolk Naval Yard, Ducky's investigation reveals a telltale mark on the victim's carotid artery, suggesting he was injected with poison. Initial inquiries focus on a petty officer with a history of drug use who may have wanted the doctor to remain silent about his problems. American drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team are called in when a Navy reservist returns home to find her husband missing and her living room covered in blood, and make a grim discovery when they find a finger in the bin. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: As Brenda and Fritz's wedding day approaches, one is preoccupied with a murder case and the other with the search for a drug lord. Starring Kyra Sedgwick and Jon Tenney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick as Deputy Chief Brenda Leigh Johnson, who heads the Priority Murder Squad, a special unit of the LAPD handling sensitive, high-profile murders. In her first case since arriving in Los Angeles, Brenda uncovers a disastrous love affair and a mysterious past as she investigates a death at the home of a multi-millionaire computer company executive.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a high-profile model, killed with the unusual weapon of poisoned hair conditioner. While suspicion initially falls on the victim's film-star husband, the case proves more complicated than expected. The detective is also reunited with an old boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a Russian prostitute - and discovers some very famous names on her list of clients. programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda looks into a series of gang shootings that appears to have been carried out by a military sniper. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Kyle Friedgen is accused of killing his ex-girlfriend, but while his case is dismissed due to a mishandled warrant, his life and reputation are marred by suspicion that he got away with murder. Determined to clear his name in full, Friedgen volunteers to be court-martialled, on the condition that the NCIS team conducts its own investigation. Meanwhile, Bishop and Jake discuss their marital problems. Naval crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham, with Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The two Marine brothers of a sailor battling leukaemia are killed in the line of duty, and to spare the servicemen's family further grief, the secretary of the US Navy seeks the NCIS team's help in locating a suitable bone marrow donor. Meanwhile, Bishop returns home to Oklahoma for Thanksgiving. Military crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois is forced to find a job when the family's domestic finances are stretched. Meanwhile, Peter acquires a pet falcon.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: An unfortunate sky-diving accident leaves Peter in hospital, where he meets a man named Mahmoud. Animated comedy, featuring the guest voice of Omid Abtahi.(n)

programme.desc: While testing a top-secret CIA surveillance device, Stan is shocked to discover his neighbours do not think very highly of him. In retaliation he evicts the whole neighbourhood so he can live free from criticism - but soon realises his mistake.(n)

programme.desc: Stan gets into trouble for delivering contaminated cattle to a slaughterhouse as part of a plan to make a man out of Steve. Meanwhile, Roger causes trouble between Francine and Hayley.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan takes Francine to a baseball game to celebrate her birthday, but when the ground's `kiss cam' broadcasts their particularly horrible kiss to the rest of the spectators, Stan begins to question everything about his marriage. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger head to Nevada to help clean up polluted water. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A sexy new next-door neighbour promises to take Steve and his friends' virginity in return for them doing the housework.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris wants to start a new hobby and befriends a puppeteer named Franz, an old friend of Herbert's. Despite hearing warnings about the entertainer's past, the duo remain friends until Franz's dark history is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The grand opening of Pryde Castle ends in disaster when a guide is struck by an arrow, and Father Brown becomes convinced that the motive lies buried in the Pryde family's past. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Convicted killer Violet is given a temporary reprieve from the gallows, and begs Father Brown to help prove her innocence. However, with only three days in which to do it, he must try to find the real culprit before it's too late. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of an old friend leads Father Brown and Sid on a quest to find the mythical Lannington Rosary, and an old adversary, seemingly back from the dead, must be trusted to help. Mark Williams stars.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Armed only with a telescope, the priest hopes that a broken leg will not prevent him from solving the mystery surrounding the death of a member of Kembleford's Women's Institute. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Nancy Carroll and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A troubled young woman's father is killed three weeks after the death of her mother, leaving the priest to console the bereaved while trying to solve a puzzling murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is unconvinced when a recently returned PoW is accused of killing his uncle, and it seems that someone will stop at nothing to keep Father Brown from the truth. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A death on a local farm is blamed on a Kembleford doctor through a series of poison pen letters, and Father Brown must try to find out who sent them to save his friend from the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A day out at a local hill climb track ends with one of the drivers being killed. Father Brown persists with his personal investigation, and an infuriated Sullivan resolves to put an end to his meddling for good. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Richard Poole meets up with a group of old university friends who have arrived on the island for a reunion, only for tragedy to strike when the man who has solved so many murders becomes the victim. Faced with such a sensitive crime, the commissioner quickly drafts in another British inspector to help the team get to the bottom of the mystery. It soon becomes clear that the newcomer, Humphrey Goodman, is just as eccentric as Poole - but he is also just as bright, and wastes no time questioning the partygoers, all of whom are prime suspects, while pondering the biggest mystery of all - how did the culprit commit the crime in full view of all the other guests? Kris Marshall joins the cast, with Ben Miller, Sara Martins and Danny John-Jules.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A zombie movie being filmed on the island ends in real-life horror when a stand-in is poisoned - and new detective inspector Humphrey soon deduces that the unfortunate victim was not the killer's intended target. He believes the culprit was after lead actress Lexi Cunningham, but the murder plot went wrong. The Caribbean cops focus their attention on three suspects - film director Carl Collins, screenwriter Arnold Finch and production assistant Susie Jenkins. But why would any of them want the star dead? Michelle Ryan, Peter Davison and Hannah Tointon guest star.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and the team are called upon to investigate the death of Fidel's old school friend, Carlton Paris, who has been shot at home. The victim was last seen alive at an art gallery with Dorothy Foster, a wealthy older woman - and before long they discover he made his living as an escort and had left several disgruntled and heartbroken women in his wake, including a local judge and the wife of a club owner. But as the investigation progresses, Fidel struggles to keep his emotions in check, forcing him to confront some long-buried issues. Kris Marshall and Gary Carr star, with guest appearances from Adrian Scarborough, Sharon Small, Tristan Gemmill and Josette Simon.(n)

programme.title: Wedding Planner Mystery
programme.desc: A meticulous event organiser ends up the prime suspect when a murder occurs during a wedding she is overseeing, and the bride is subsequently kidnapped. She sets out to prove her innocence, which leads to a romance with a lawyer, who may have his own criminal agenda. Whodunnit based on Deborah Donnelly's novel Veiled Threats, starring Erica Durance and Andrew W Walker.(n)

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A member of staff is found dead at the hospital and Lawson identifies a former morgue attendant who appears to have vanished without a trace as his prime suspect. Meanwhile, preparations for the Anzac Day celebrations are underway, and Blake encounters an old friend who is on the lookout for two deserters. Detective drama, starring Joel Tobeck.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A voodoo priestess who predicted her own murder is found dead in the local school - and while the team thinks her prophecy has come true, Richard is more inclined to believe it is simply an old-fashioned killing. He soon discovers a link to an affair between the school priest and the wife of the headmaster - a scandal that led to a woman's disappearance years before. Caribbean crime drama, starring Ben Miller and Sara Martins, with Mona Hammond, Michael Maloney and Nicholas Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The Edinburgh detective investigates the murder of notorious gangster Morris Cafferty's illegitimate son, as the search goes on to find the person who put Sammy in a life-threatening coma. The hunt for the killer is complicated by apparent links to a spate of hate crimes by racist extremists in the city centre. Gritty crime thriller, starring John Hannah and James Cosmo.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Armed only with a telescope, the priest hopes that a broken leg will not prevent him from solving the mystery surrounding the death of a member of Kembleford's Women's Institute. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Nancy Carroll and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A troubled young woman's father is killed three weeks after the death of her mother, leaving the priest to console the bereaved while trying to solve a puzzling murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: An air stewardess makes her last flight when she is poisoned during her crew's overnight stay on the island. Humphrey and his team are called to the victim's hotel and begin by questioning her colleagues, but with so many suspects and so little to go on, they are left scratching their heads trying to work out which of her colleagues wanted her dead - so Dwayne goes rogue to pursue his own line of inquiry. Kris Marshall and Danny John-Jules star in the light-hearted Caribbean crime drama.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island's commerce minister is shot dead in his home, and with the incident coming shortly after the exposure of a scandalous affair - not to mention a suicide note at the scene - it looks like an open-and-shut case. But Humphrey isn't convinced and believes someone else was responsible for the killing, whittling down the possible suspects to leave his betrayed wife, his son and his mistress in the frame. The rest of the team struggles to see past the physical evidence, which still suggests he took his own life - and then matters are complicated even further when Camille gets a blast from the past.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A birdwatcher is stabbed to death with his own knife, a case that holds a certain fascination for Humphrey, who was a keen twitcher in his youth. The victim was one of a group of enthusiasts who had visited the island for a glimpse of a famous parrot - but the team soon faces a conundrum as all the suspects were in full sight of one another when the crime was committed. As the cops search for answers, they uncover evidence of long-standing rivalries, secret jealousies and romantic entanglements. But would any of it justify killing a harmless ornithologist?.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and his colleagues are called to a neighbouring private island whose property developer owner has been shot dead at a family gathering. Five people are in the frame - the victim's housekeeper, his PA and his three children - although when an approaching hurricane strands the cops on the island, knocking out the phones and computers, they are forced to rely on good old-fashioned investigative techniques. As evening approaches, the cops realise they will be spending the night in a house with a killer. Can they solve the mystery before he or she strikes again? Jimmy Akingbola (Holby's Antoine Malick) and Nikki Amuka-Bird (Luther) guest star.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Goodman is called in to investigate the death of former surgeon Emma Redding at a retirement home. With an empty packet of sleeping pills beside her body and her room locked from the inside, it looks like an open-and-shut case of suicide. However, the team discovers everything is not as it seems and mounting evidence suggests she may in fact have been poisoned. Then, a blast from Humphrey's past arrives unexpectedly on the island, and looks set to distract him from solving the case. Guest starring Rupert Vansittart, Joanna David, Phil Davis and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Richard Poole meets up with a group of old university friends who have arrived on the island for a reunion, only for tragedy to strike when the man who has solved so many murders becomes the victim. Faced with such a sensitive crime, the commissioner quickly drafts in another British inspector to help the team get to the bottom of the mystery. It soon becomes clear that the newcomer, Humphrey Goodman, is just as eccentric as Poole - but he is also just as bright, and wastes no time questioning the partygoers, all of whom are prime suspects, while pondering the biggest mystery of all - how did the culprit commit the crime in full view of all the other guests? Kris Marshall joins the cast, with Ben Miller, Sara Martins and Danny John-Jules.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A zombie movie being filmed on the island ends in real-life horror when a stand-in is poisoned - and new detective inspector Humphrey soon deduces that the unfortunate victim was not the killer's intended target. He believes the culprit was after lead actress Lexi Cunningham, but the murder plot went wrong. The Caribbean cops focus their attention on three suspects - film director Carl Collins, screenwriter Arnold Finch and production assistant Susie Jenkins. But why would any of them want the star dead? Michelle Ryan, Peter Davison and Hannah Tointon guest star.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and the team are called upon to investigate the death of Fidel's old school friend, Carlton Paris, who has been shot at home. The victim was last seen alive at an art gallery with Dorothy Foster, a wealthy older woman - and before long they discover he made his living as an escort and had left several disgruntled and heartbroken women in his wake, including a local judge and the wife of a club owner. But as the investigation progresses, Fidel struggles to keep his emotions in check, forcing him to confront some long-buried issues. Kris Marshall and Gary Carr star, with guest appearances from Adrian Scarborough, Sharon Small, Tristan Gemmill and Josette Simon.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: An air stewardess makes her last flight when she is poisoned during her crew's overnight stay on the island. Humphrey and his team are called to the victim's hotel and begin by questioning her colleagues, but with so many suspects and so little to go on, they are left scratching their heads trying to work out which of her colleagues wanted her dead - so Dwayne goes rogue to pursue his own line of inquiry. Kris Marshall and Danny John-Jules star in the light-hearted Caribbean crime drama.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island's commerce minister is shot dead in his home, and with the incident coming shortly after the exposure of a scandalous affair - not to mention a suicide note at the scene - it looks like an open-and-shut case. But Humphrey isn't convinced and believes someone else was responsible for the killing, whittling down the possible suspects to leave his betrayed wife, his son and his mistress in the frame. The rest of the team struggles to see past the physical evidence, which still suggests he took his own life - and then matters are complicated even further when Camille gets a blast from the past.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A birdwatcher is stabbed to death with his own knife, a case that holds a certain fascination for Humphrey, who was a keen twitcher in his youth. programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A member of staff is found dead at the hospital and Lawson identifies a former morgue attendant who appears to have vanished without a trace as his prime suspect. Meanwhile, preparations for the Anzac Day celebrations are underway, and Blake encounters an old friend who is on the lookout for two deserters. Detective drama, starring Joel Tobeck.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A voodoo priestess who predicted her own murder is found dead in the local school - and while the team thinks her prophecy has come true, Richard is more inclined to believe it is simply an old-fashioned killing. He soon discovers a link to an affair between the school priest and the wife of the headmaster - a scandal that led to a woman's disappearance years before. Caribbean crime drama, starring Ben Miller and Sara Martins, with Mona Hammond, Michael Maloney and Nicholas Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The Edinburgh detective investigates the murder of notorious gangster Morris Cafferty's illegitimate son, as the search goes on to find the person who put Sammy in a life-threatening coma. The hunt for the killer is complicated by apparent links to a spate of hate crimes by racist extremists in the city centre. Gritty crime thriller, starring John Hannah and James Cosmo.(n)

programme.title: The Mindy Project
programme.desc: The love-lorn gynaecologist comes up with an elaborate plan to secure the affections of lawyer Cliff (guest star Glenn Howerton) by arranging a Christmas party, inviting the employees of every company in the building. However, things fail to go according to plan when Brendan's date Maria Menounos (guest starring has herself) steals her thunder with a decidedly seductive performance of Santa Baby. Comedy, starring Mindy Kaling.(n)

programme.title: The Mindy Project
programme.sub-title: Danny Castellano Is My Personal Trainer.
programme.desc: In a last-minute attempt to get fit before her weekend away with Cliff, Mindy asks Danny to become her personal trainer. Meanwhile, back in the office Peter has to take on extra responsibilities when Jeremy is off sick. Comedy, starring Mindy Kaling.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Bonnie feels unappreciated for all the work she does for the boys and Emma, and decides to go on strike. However, Ben soon realises how much he needs his mother's help, and comes up with a way to get back into her good books.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Now that she knows the truth about Margot, Riley decides to look for her biological father too, and uses her parents' high-school yearbook as a guide. With a little help from Ben, she narrows down the possible candidates to an easy-going pastry chef and a high-flying lawyer. Comedy, starring Chelsea Kane and Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney seduces Marshall's professor in the hope of improving his friend's grades, but finds his bedroom performance being graded instead. Lily takes a job at Ted's office, where she teaches his bullying boss Mr Druthers a lesson that lands her new colleagues in trouble. Guest starring Bryan Cranston (Breaking Bad) and Jane Seymour (Dr Quinn: Medicine Woman), with Alyson Hannigan and Neil Patrick Harris.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily becomes jealous of Marshall and Chloe's relationship and starts stalking the couple, while Ted and Barney try to convince Marshall that his new girlfriend is not sane and that he would be better off without her. Guest starring Morena Baccarin (Homeland).(n)

programme.title: Made in Chelsea: South of France
programme.desc: Francis's affections continue to be in demand as Olivia declares her feelings, while Alik files out to Cannes to try to rekindle his romance with Louise.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Grace is furious with Sienna and wants revenge, while John Paul is stuck in the middle as Myra and Sally continue to argue over him. Jesse catches Celine's eye and she offers to give him a hot stone massage - but it does not go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: The group heads to Florence, where two tourists become competitive at a sculpting class before everyone gets very messy at a pizza kitchen and there is a surprise yellow card.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: As the travelling popularity contest continues, one tourist takes things a bit too far at a wine tasting and upsets Brendan. Plus, there is a dramatic double yellow card vote.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: During a visit to a natural spa, the group is surprised when one couple has a big row. Meanwhile, Brendan causes a stir, and one pair's trip comes to an end after the vote.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: The coach reaches Rome, where the tourists enjoy a white-knuckle buggy tour. At the vote, one couple are accused of sly game playing.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: The coach makes it back to Spain, where the sun is shining and the group are fighting. Adrenaline-filled, wet and wild trips to a zipline and a waterpark cannot distract the group from its infighting, resulting in a fiery vote.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly discovers Adam is failing in Spanish class, and immediately blames his teacher. However, when she arranges for him to receive extra tuition, her plan backfires.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: As the 1984 presidential election approaches, Erica discovers that Beverly always just votes for the same candidate as Murray, and she sets out to educate her mother. Barry wants to appear on a sporty game show to prove his athletic prowess to his friends.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: After watching a particular game show together for years, Adam and Emmy are excited to learn that the producers will be holding auditions at their school. Beverly turns to Bill for help when Barry and Murray become convinced that she is a lucky charm for their beleaguered football team.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry takes inspiration from Lionel Richie and sets about creating a sculpture of Lainey as the ultimate Valentine's Day gift. Murray advises Adam to defy his mother and sneak into a screening of the restricted-rated film Porky's, and Geoff agrees to be just good friends with Erica.(n)

programme.title: ParaNorman
programme.desc: A misunderstood boy is able to communicate with ghosts haunting his neighbourhood, but no one else believes they exist. When a curse placed on the town by a witch centuries ago causes zombies to rise from the grave, it falls to the youngster to avert disaster. Animated adventure, with the voices of Kodi Smit-McPhee and John Goodman.(n)

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, including a man pretending to be a walrus, and incredible downhill bike run and some computer keyboard hurling.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard turns to Penny for advice when his relationship with Stephanie takes off faster than he would have liked, and he realises he is the last person to notice that she has moved in with him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette annoys his friends as Christmas approaches. Meanwhile, Leonard is thrilled to meet an award-winning scientist, only to be filled with jealousy when his new colleague takes an interest in Penny. With guest star Michael Trucco (Battlestar Galactica, One Tree Hill).(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and the gang are excited when Barry Kripke challenges them to a robot duel. Meanwhile, Howard is devastated when Penny finally tells him what she thinks of his chauvinism. Guest starring John Ross Bowie.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon decides to put his formidable brain power to use in devising a scientific procedure for making friends. However, to prove his findings he must first win the trust of fellow scientist Barry Kripke to gain access to a powerful computer. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and John Ross Bowie.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny runs into money troubles, so Sheldon offers to lend her some cash to help her pay the rent. However, when Leonard discovers his neighbour's ex-boyfriend Kurt is the cause of her financial woes, he gathers the gang for a confrontation. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet a psychiatrist on her behalf, while Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery. Stuart moves out, but Howard and Bernadette's happiness is short-lived. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After being forced to deal with a sick Sheldon, the rest of the gang try to treat themselves to a Sheldon-free weekend. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The couch-potato critics provide running commentary on another selection of TV programmes from the comfort of their sofa, casting their eyes over I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, Stephen Hawking: A Brief History of Mine, and Robbie Williams: One Night at the Palladium. Linguist Louis is struggling to learn the language of love, and within seconds of meeting Adela, his nerves takes hold and silence descends on the table. Meanwhile, Michael and Karina share their experiences of parenthood, and writer Louis seems more concerned with the price of the meal as he meets spiritual barmaid Amber.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Grace is furious with Sienna and wants revenge, while John Paul is stuck in the middle as Myra and Sally continue to argue over him. Jesse catches Celine's eye and she offers to give him a hot stone massage - but it does not go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe and Piper vie for Leo's attention, and a troubled teenager befriends Phoebe in the hope of joining the Halliwells. Unfortunately, they do not realise she is under the control of a sorceress who wants her to steal their powers.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.desc: Ryder announces that he plans to join the US Navy, but Mel and Joe are unconvinced that he is prepared for military life, and come up with a plan to make him change his mind. Their plot involves Joe pretending to support the youngster's decision by giving him a taste of what to expect during his training, but instead devising a fiendish mock boot camp intended to persuade him the life of a serviceman is not for him. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joe Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jeff feels threatened by Audrey's salary increase, leading to a power struggle between them. Russell is disappointed to learn Liz is dating Todd, and orders Timmy to discover why she has chosen him. Jen and Adam make the most of the situation when a waiter believes they have just got engaged.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.sub-title: The Last of the Red Hat Lovers.

Jeff and Audrey stay in his flat while he is away, and soon get into a quarrel that only finishes when Timmy uses CCTV footage to help resolve their disagreement.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.sub-title: The Truth Is Out There and It Hurts.
programme.desc: Acting on Phoebe's premonitions, the sisters try to stop a mysterious killer from striking again. Meanwhile, Prue uses a truth spell on Andy to find out how he would react to the revelation that she is a witch. Supernatural drama, starring Shannen Doherty and Holly Marie Combs.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: A warlock from the past is released from his curse and tries to steal the sisters' powers with the help of Rex and Hannah, but the resourceful three resurrect one of their ancestors to combat him. programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube

Finally, in Partysaurus Rex, normally cautious Rex throws an over-the-top, bubble-filled bash for the bathroom toys. With the voices of Tom Hanks, Tim Allen and Joan Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Toy Story That Time Forgot

They encounter a range of dinosaur action figures, but discover they do not know they are toys. When the leader of the prehistoric monsters decides Buzz and Woody must fight for their lives in a gladiatorial arena, it falls to Trixie the triceratops to save her friends by convincing him of his true nature. Short animated comedy spin-off from the Pixar series, with the voices of Tom Hanks, Tim Allen and Kristen Schaal.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Flaming Spittoon Acquisition.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Go Dating: The Date Night Variable.

programme.desc: Howard finds out that he has a half-brother, Sheldon and Amy have a platonic sleepover, and Penny gets an offer to audition for a Kevin Smith film. American comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.desc: Francis and Olivia grow closer, but Toff worries about seeing them together, Sam tries to convince Tiff he is committed to her and Jess is totally smitten with her new French beau.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny share an intimate moment as they recover from a psychological deconstruction by the physicist's mother, an expert in psychiatry and neural sciences. Guest starring Mamma Mia! actress Christine Baranski.(n)

programme.desc: Tensions between Sheldon and Penny reach a new high after a paintballing accident leaves an ugly stain on the awkward physicist's favourite sofa cushion. Meanwhile, romance blossoms between Leslie and Howard. Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer's Stately Homes
programme.desc: The property expert visits Woburn Abbey in Bedfordshire, ancestral home of the Dukes of Bedford for nearly 400 years, and `meets' some of its ancestors.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
