programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Single mother Lindsay Pulford hosts the second party in west Lancashire, hoping to impress her fellow diners with a Caribbean-themed night. However, as soon as the guests arrive, they begin to regale her with reminders of her antics the previous evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: History student and part-time bartender Chris Mosey hosts the third dinner party in west Lancashire. He is confident about his cooking skills and has designed a menu that includes blue cheesecake and Scouse tapas.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cleaner Louise Dee hosts the penultimate dinner party in west Lancashire and provides her guests with a Spanish-inspired menu and an `old skool rave' before her rivals give their thoughts on the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Medical photographer Lorraine Rimmer hosts the final dinner party in west Lancashire, and hopes to impress her guests with a menu consisting of authentic Spanish cuisine, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Black Lion in Halland, East Sussex, where host Nigel Fright gets off to a shaky start when a kettle goes missing from one of the rooms. Later, he takes the guests to a salsa class, where Sherrill Tacy and Hayley Cotton are surprised by some of his dance moves.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Wheatsheaf Inn in Exning, near Newmarket, Suffolk, where guests are welcomed by owner Ken Clutterbuck and employee Ginny Trow. The proprietor tries to win his rivals round with his unique sense of humour, but tensions rise when the contestants go for a spin on a go-kart track.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sherrill Tacy hosts at the Sherwood Guest House in New Brighton on the Wirral, and is praised for the establishment's value for money. However, there is upset when her breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, and her final review is far from perfect.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Final hosts Mark and Rachael Dann welcome the contestants to the Big Bear Lodge in Shropshire. They face the tough job of trying to keep the rift between some of the guests to a minimum in their ski-themed B&B, and their afternoon activity of canoeing raises a few laughs but accusations of cheating occur when the boys begin to get competitive.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother Gemma Willock hosts the first party in the West Midlands, and her evening of glitz and glamour looks set to be a roaring success until an unwelcome revelation about her corner-cutting approach to the competition threatens her chances of taking the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mortgage adviser Andrew Devey throws the second party in the West Midlands, hosting a beatnik-themed evening. He cooks shepherd's pie for his main course, as well as lining up some pop art in the hope that it will expand his guests' minds.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vegetarian Jules Evans hosts the third day of the competition in the West Midlands, and plans to indulge her passion for historical re-enactments by planning a medieval-themed dinner. The guests offer mixed responses when they look at the menu, but things take a turn for the better when she announces a duel will form part of the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Massage therapist Lucy Hird hosts the fourth dinner party from the West Midlands, featuring an extensive menu full of Thai specialities. She also gives individual presents to her guests, but her night is compromised by the entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mental-health nurse Lloyd Cast hosts the final dinner party from the West Midlands. Despite appearing to be an extrovert so far, he decides on a chilled theme for the evening to allow his food to take centre stage, before the winner of the £1,000 is announced.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extreme
programme.desc: From Siberia to India, the Andes to the Arctic, this programme looks at the world's 10 most extreme roads. Dashboard-mounted cameras capture mayhem in Russia, while in the US, helicopters bomb snowy mountainsides to launch huge avalanches that will help to keep the roads open and safe. In the Australian Outback - where kangaroos can pose more risk than other motorists - truck drivers face all kinds of dangers to deliver their cargo.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: A sense of dread descends on Craggy Island as the priests prepare for poker-faced Father Stone's annual visit - and Ted tries desperately to think of a scheme to get rid of him. Clerical comedy, starring Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Bishop Brennan orders Ted and Dougal to campaign against a controversial film - but as a result of their protest it becomes the biggest box-office hit in Craggy Island's history. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon, Frank Kelly and Pauline McLynn.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Best Loved Sitcoms
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tamsin Greig narrates this countdown of the shows that have made millions laugh over the past 50 years. From recent series like The Office, Twenty Twelve, Mrs Brown's Boys and Peep Show, to old classics such as The Likely Lads, Dad's Army and Steptoe and Son, which one will come out on top in a UK poll? The programme features interviews with genre favourites, including Brendan O'Carroll, Richard Wilson, Tony Robinson, Ricky Tomlinson and Wendy Craig.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Rhod Gilbert and Sara Pascoe. Countdown regular Susie Dent is assisted in Dictionary Corner by Johnny Vegas, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from Joey Essex.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Pub landlord Tony is brought in with burnt legs as a result of his barbecue gas cylinder exploding - made slightly worse by the fact he was only wearing boxer shorts at the time. Henry, a 93-year-old war veteran, is rushed in with severe breathing difficulties, and builder Bill was knocked unconscious after falling off his shed. His CT scan reveals he has broken his neck in three places, and he may need surgery to avoid damage to his spinal cord.(n)

programme.title: That's So Last Century
programme.desc: Celebrities including Jimmy Carr, James Corden, Dom Joly, Will Mellor, Vic Reeves and Doc Brown rediscover late-20th-century toys, such as Magic Eye books, Domino Rally, Crossfire, Subbuteo, and the Game Boy, plus some very unusual dolls, and the Omnibot robot butler.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Rhod Gilbert and Sara Pascoe. Countdown regular Susie Dent is assisted in Dictionary Corner by Johnny Vegas, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from Joey Essex.(n)

programme.title: Hugh's 3 Good Things: Best Bites
programme.desc: Highlights of the series with Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall providing tips to make things easy in the kitchen, as he sets out to show viewers how to achieve the maximum taste with the minimum of fuss.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: Foraging guide John Wright tries to find laver, a type of seaweed most commonly harvested and cooked in Wales, before using it to prepare a dish with bacon and clams.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Elsa and Brian Surridge, who are looking for a retirement home on the Costa Blanca and have a cash budget of £75,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Stockport couple Gillian and Paul Clarke search for a holiday home on Spain's Costa Calida on a budget of £45,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at One4 B&B in Cheltenham, where debonair art-dealing host Nick Purchase hopes to prove his that his establishment offers the best value for money. However, things get off to a less-than-ideal start when a life-drawing class leaves one of his guests in a fit of nervous giggles.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Windy Bottom B&B in Maidstone, Kent, where owners Gloria Barnett and Dave Goulding try to impress their guests with a trip to Leeds Castle. However, a proprietor manages to offend one of her rivals, and another is not impressed at being allocated a Versace-themed room.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Jolly Carter pub in Bolton, Greater Manchester, run by Phil and Angie Sutcliffe. Despite a few nerves about the accommodation not measuring up, the room inspections go well, but the guests' verdict on the afternoon's roller disco remains to be seen.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: John Humberstone hosts at the 18-room Alexandra Hotel in Llandudno, where he hopes the scaffolding on the outside of his establishment will not ruin his chances. However, when one of the guests gets locked in a bathroom and there is a slip-up with towels and teabags, it seems he has plenty of other things to worry about.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured on the show reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Andrea Nichols hosts the first night in a week of dinner parties that span Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. She welcomes dance instructor Nicola O'Donnell, saleswoman Penny Peklivanas, music producer Tim Lawson and events entertainer Andy Harvey into her garden that has been decked out with straw and stuffed chickens in a bid to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kitchenware saleswoman Penny Peklivanas hosts the second party in a competition that spans Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. She is confident her grand house will impress her rivals and win her the £1,000 cash prize, but her croissant-based main course is not to everyone's taste.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT analyst and music producer Tim Lawson hosts the third dinner party of the week in the competition taking place across Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire, hoping to impress his diners with ingredients brought back from Morocco. He also offers an urban music education in a bid to claim the £1,000-prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance instructor Nicola O'Donnell hosts the fourth dinner party of the competition spanning Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. The guests expect very little from the night, but Nicola hopes to impress Jamaican-born contestant Tim Lawson with her Caribbean-inspired evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Andy Harvey hosts the final night of the competition which has visited Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. He decides to pull out all the stops at his Stevenage home, hoping to impress with extravagant food and outrageous entertainment - including a luminous underwater disco. At the end of the evening, his dinner guests reveal their scores before the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed.(n)

programme.title: The 100 Greatest Musicals
programme.desc: Denise Van Outen concludes the rundown of viewers' favourite musicals, counting down from 50 to number one. Featuring interviews with stars including Scott Baio (Bugsy Malone), Lee Curreri (Fame), Ron Moody (Oliver!) and Susan Sarandon (The Rocky Horror Picture Show), as well as directors, writers and producers including Randal Kleiser (Grease), Rob Marshall (Chicago), Alan Parker (Evita, Fame and Bugsy Malone) and Cameron Mackintosh and Willy Russell (Blood Brothers). Plus, Omar Sharif, Elaine Paige, Michael Ball, Claire Sweeney, Jonathan Wilkes and Miss Piggy are among the contributors who reveal the impact these musicals have had on their lives.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Francis and Karen Shaw, who are hoping to save a castle in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales. While the project is a chance to fulfil a childhood dream, the building is a scheduled ancient monument protected by numerous regulations. As their expenses increase and they enter their second year of work, they suffer many setbacks.(n)

programme.title: Four Rooms
programme.desc: Celia Sawyer, Alex Proud, Pearl Lowe and Andrew Lamberty compete for a Vulcan aircraft engine table, horror film posters, a taxidermy lion's head and a Rolex trench watch.(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Mega Yachts
programme.desc: Documentary about the Monaco Yacht Show, where over 100 of the largest yachts on the water are up for sale, with billionaire buyers competing to own the most extravagant vessels. The programme follows those who make, buy and work on these craft, including a Soho businessman planning to sail around the world, a broker with 25 years experience looking to sell a £130 million yacht, and a billionaire installing a crystal chandelier in his floating palace.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Pub landlord Tony is brought in with burnt legs as a result of his barbecue gas cylinder exploding - made slightly worse by the fact he was only wearing boxer shorts at the time. Henry, a 93-year-old war veteran, is rushed in with severe breathing difficulties, and builder Bill was knocked unconscious after falling off his shed. His CT scan reveals he has broken his neck in three places, and he may need surgery to avoid damage to his spinal cord.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Four hitherto strangers strangers from Cardiff compete for the £1,000 prize. First to host is competitive 43-year-old Lianne, who has dubbed herself the `queen of cooking'. Second up is self-proclaimed large ego Ross, who has an encounter with some very fishy scallops. Then it's the turn of sales manager Grace, whose selling is put to the test. Lastly, former businessman, now actor and musician Lee pulls out all the glitz and glam with a Rat Pack-themed evening, which includes a full swing band in his living room.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Data analyst Chris is the first of four contestants in Manchester, hoping to impress his rivals with a Mexican feast, followed 24 hours later by fun-loving security officer Regan, whose burnt ribs and soggy nachos prove disappointing. The final two evenings see a battle between French and English as the hosts celebrate their own nationalities, although with Thomas's fatty duck being spat out at the table and a few sneaky cheats in the kitchen by self-proclaimed `hostess with the mostest' Wendy, it seems the competition really could be anybody's.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hotel manager David hosts the first of four dinner parties in Glasgow, with a modern day Irish menu, served with cabbage pesto. The second day is the turn of history student Katy, who has a love of all things 1920s, and glamour loving Liz hosts the third night with a Scottish menu of Chicken Balmoral and haggis. Adi finishes the week with a meal of Scottish venison and scallops, and the tension that has been simmering comes to head with the arrival of an unexpected guest.(n)

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George is joined by leading architects to help transform some of Britain's most unloved houses into desirable properties, beginning with the 1970s home of Tony and Sarah in the Vale of Glamorgan. The couple want rid of the pebbledash facade, small windows and dated decor, to create a great family home on a relatively modest budget of £60,000. They receive some bespoke and cutting-edge input from commercial and residential architect Greg Blee, with a plan that will link their home to the landscape beyond, including a Shard-like extension.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: George Clarke's Amazing Builds by the Sea.
programme.desc: The presenter looks back at some of his favourite builds by the sea, including a multifunctional beach hut in Bournemouth, Dorset, built for less than £400, and a 21st-century update of a Victorian bathing machine in Margate, Kent. George also looks back at some of his favourite waterside retreats in Germany - an extraordinary life guard tower and a holiday home with incredible views across the water - as well as reflecting on the seaside build he undertook with master craftsman Will Hardie that pushed the humble beach hut to its limits by making it float in the open sea.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Return of the programme in which the property expert comes to the rescue of people stuck in homes they cannot sell. In the first edition, Phil travels to Waterlooville, Hampshire, where he offers advice to Pauline Ridley who has been trying to sell her three-bed terrace for six months without any luck. He believes her love of purple and pink decor is putting off potential buyers, and he suspects there could be an asbestos problem as well.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Retired vet Bruce Marsden is looking for a holiday home in Crete, so Laura Hamilton shows what his £250,000 budget will buy around the Chania area of the island.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: A sculptor wants to sell a life-size statue of David Beckham, James takes a rare Porsche for a spin, and Claudia values a pair of designer handbags for a customer who is trying to fund a mansion for her cat. A member of the team drops a bombshell as a rival high-end pawnbroking store opens its doors in Manchester City Centre.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay travels to the El Greco restaurant in Austin, Texas, where the owners have resorted to using a microwave to prepare their `authentic' Greek dishes. Gordon faces the difficult task of uniting a squabbling family before tackling the bigger problem of a business on the brink of collapse.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps a couple looking for a home in Warrington, who do not seem to be able to agree on the best approach to house hunting, which has led to six months with no progress. In Liverpool, Phil Spencer comes to the aid of a successful entrepreneur looking for a house in Crosby, but who has very specific ideas.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Britain by Drone
programme.desc: Tony Robinson presents the first of two programmes using drones to shoot aerial footage of areas of Britain that are off limits to the public. Among the locations featured is a village on Salisbury Plain that is not listed on any maps, and is used by the military for training. The drones record an exercise involving tanks storming the area. Other sites include the world's most advanced container port, a Second World War bunker, an abandoned airbase that once housed nuclear weapons, and an 18th-century mansion belonging to a Russian billionaire.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales explore a network that is completely new to them as they embark on a voyage across the Netherlands. Their journey takes them to the gardens of Keukenhof and the Teylers Museum in Haarlem, before they arrive in Amsterdam, where they tour the capital's canal district - the Grachtengordel.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: People who risk ruining their own lives for the sake of a night out, including a professional footballer almost triple the legal drink drive limit while on his way to training after drinking heavily the night before. In Crewe, PCs Vicky Howell and Greg Greaves get an eyeful on their Saturday night patrol as they stop a man walking along a main road, naked from the waist down. He doesn't know where his trousers are and it's down to the police to make sure he gets home safely.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay travels to the El Greco restaurant in Austin, Texas, where the owners have resorted to using a microwave to prepare their `authentic' Greek dishes. Gordon faces the difficult task of uniting a squabbling family before tackling the bigger problem of a business on the brink of collapse.(n)

programme.title: President Trump: Can He Really Win
programme.desc: Matt Frei asks whether the tycoon Donald Trump could actually become US President or if he will be crushed by the opposition, Hillary Clinton. He meets Trump supporters and conflicted Republicans, and considering Trump's derogatory remarks on women, Frei also asks whether the billionaire can really win over the all-significant female vote.(n)

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross, Noel Fielding, Richard Ayoade, Aisling Bea, Adam Buxton and Rob Beckett are quizzed by Jimmy Carr on the past 100,000 years of history, with topics ranging from science to music, food and drink to crime and punishment, and TV to politics. Jimmy is ably assisted by Big Fat Quiz favourites Jon Snow, the children of Mitchell Brook Primary School and Joey Essex, as well as a whole host of famous question setters.(n)

programme.title: Fresh Meat
programme.desc: The newly non-funded wheelchair rugby team protests against Oregon's presidency, Josie is having an identity crisis and takes the drastic measure of rebranding herself, and Vod decides to retreat to an anarchist commune, with the other two girls tagging along. The boys head to London, where Kingsley feels positive about a potential post at a radio station, JP visits his brother's firm to `collect his job' and Howard tries to familiarise himself with the city before he goes for his interview at the Ordnance Survey.(n)

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting some of One Born Every Minute's most memorable parents, including Lucy as she plans to pursue her goal of returning to professional opera singing two years after the birth of her third child. Kirri and Brendan are looking to recapture their youthful spark following the delivery of their second born. Plus, Detroit-born Shannon and her Yorkshire husband Chris try to combine the best of both worlds as they raise their two children.(n)

programme.title: Grayson Perry: All Man
programme.desc: Turner Prize-winning artist Grayson Perry is not your typical man. As a frock-wearing, mountain-biking father-of-one, he has a unique perspective of the male psyche. In this three-part documentary, he investigates modern masculinity, beginning with the world of cage-fighting, or mixed-martial arts, in North East England. As a self-described `sissy', he has a problem with machismo, but as he spends time with the fighters, many of his prejudices are overturned - especially as he realises the struggles some of these men have faced in trying to live up to these masculine ideals.(n)

programme.title: Wedding Town
programme.desc: Cameras follow brides and grooms who have chosen to marry or renew their vows in Gretna Green, as well as the work of the people trying make each ceremony special. In the opening edition, theatre-lovers Lynn and Roger plans to get hitched hit problems, while local entrepreneur Jackie wants to shake up the village's wedding scene by bringing a bit of Las Vegas magic to proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Julie hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham, hoping to win over her guests with a no-nonsense menu she can prepare in advance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty teacher Ashleigh throws the second of the week's parties in Co Durham, she hopes a menu of sophisticated dishes - along with a helping of hearts and love - will help her win the cash prize. However, cracks were already beginning to show in the diners' genial facade yesterday, and the hostess realises she must play peacemaker if she is to keep everyone from falling out.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre complaints officer and part-time farmer Stephen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham. He hopes to win the £1,000 prize money by impressing his guests with an evening on his farm, featuring a drinks reception and rustic cuisine. However, self-confessed snob Tina makes it perfectly clear what she thinks of his efforts.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Prison transport officer Tina is the fourth host in Co Durham. She hopes to impress her guests with a sophisticated French menu including salmon crepes, chicken and posh peas and pear dessert. But having been highly critical of everyone else's food so far, will they now take the chance to get their own back or can she win them round?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final evening of gatherings in Co Durham sees IT manager David stage a French-themed soiree in the hope of securing the £1,000 prize. However, he soon finds his main challenge is to keep all his guests on friendly terms.(n)

programme.title: Gok's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Gok Wan takes up the reins from Kirstie Allsopp as he reopens the Glasgow shop stocked with furniture that has been sourced for free, transforming the items and then offering them to people to furnish their homes. in the first edition, deli owners Gelsomino and Kristine from St Albans are given a makeover of their dining room and an overhaul of a listless living room.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps a couple Phil and Aud Briars in Melton Mowbray, who have been trying to sell their home for six months. The presenter suggests some work in the house and a change of colour scheme will help them to find a buyer.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help key-workers with modest budgets who want to buy their first homes in London. Civil partners Jo Hendle and Ally Macdonald have high expectations, having rented in Belsize Park, but to make the most of their £200,000 budget they need to move away from the expensive north of the capital to the more affordable south. Meanwhile, Liverpudlian Jennifer Dean hopes that £209,000 will buy her a two-bedroom period property in the south of the capital, with outside space for her cats.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou sets sail on the high seas in a historic boat, the owner of which is seeking £750,000 to fulfil his dream of becoming a well-known children's author. Meanwhile, Lawrence is tasked with selling an original Kerry Darlington painting for a memorable returning client, and Essex girl Lucy needs an urgent loan to pay for her mother's funeral, and seeks to secure the money she requires using a diamond ring that has been in her family for generations.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Return of the programme in which the property expert comes to the rescue of people stuck in homes they cannot sell. In the first edition, Phil travels to Waterlooville, Hampshire, where he offers advice to Pauline Ridley who has been trying to sell her three-bed terrace for six months without any luck. He believes her love of purple and pink decor is putting off potential buyers, and he suspects there could be an asbestos problem as well.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Aberdeen to help two sets of house hunters who have relocated to the city for work and need to find family homes quickly. Helen Barr and Brian Clarence moved from Essex while awaiting the arrival of their first child and have been living in rented accommodation, but with baby number two on the way, it's time to find a family home. However, Brian's main priority seems to be finding a bargain, while Helen doesn't want to take on a project. Meanwhile, Kirstie helps Kirsten and Scott Laing search for a semi-rural property so they can move their family up from Fife.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bristol, furniture salesman Richard, teacher Anne, paramedic Harriet and IT architect Steve try to outdo each other by throwing the perfect dinner party. As the week progresses, Anne barks at Harriet and recites erotica, while Harriet's ditsy one-liners are a constant amusement for the table. The host on the final night has just one aim - to beat Richard after his restaurant quality meal on night one. In an episode of extreme highs and ravaging lows, expectations are crushed, hidden depths are revealed and criticisms are levelled as the quartet vie for the £1000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jeweller Christian Woodall competes against beauty therapist Georgina Smith, cattle farmer Jennifer Brack and moon-walking Liam Gallagher impersonator Paul Wigfield for the £1,000 prize, as the dinner-party challenge heads to Walsall. The week sees meat feasts and animal-free meals, as well as a flurry of arguments and insults - before the hosts put aside their differences to revel in their shared love of an old Oasis hit.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: George Clarke's Amazing Builds by the Sea.
programme.desc: The presenter looks back at some of his favourite builds by the sea, including a multifunctional beach hut in Bournemouth, Dorset, built for less than £400, and a 21st-century update of a Victorian bathing machine in Margate, Kent. George also looks back at some of his favourite waterside retreats in Germany - an extraordinary life guard tower and a holiday home with incredible views across the water - as well as reflecting on the seaside build he undertook with master craftsman Will Hardie that pushed the humble beach hut to its limits by making it float in the open sea.(n)

Gordon faces the difficult task of uniting a squabbling family before tackling the bigger problem of a business on the brink of collapse.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First up is 24-year-old Rebecca, a singer from Nottinghamshire who is tired of always having her heart broken by guys with a bad boy image and wants to see if choosing a date in the studio can help her pick a better mate. Next up is 25-year-old development manager Dan from Durham, who has unsuccessfully tried countless dating apps and hopes to find Mr Right.(n)

programme.title: Operation Repo
programme.desc: Fast-paced documentary series looking at the high-pressure world of car repossession in California.(n)

programme.title: Operation Repo
programme.desc: Fast-paced documentary series looking at the high-pressure world of car repossession in California.(n)

programme.title: Custom My Ride
programme.desc: The West Coast Customs team works on a contractor's lorry for an organisation that supplies affordable housing.(n)

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a Nascar-inspired motorcycle for the Stewart-Haas racing team, and Paul Jr pitches a line of dog toys to a company based in LA.(n)

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The crew build a custom chopper for Kobalt Tools and Paul Jr gathers the family for a life-changing announcement.(n)

programme.title: Bear Grylls: Born Survivor
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls visits a region devastated by a typhoon and has to tackle swollen rivers, climb large waterfalls and use an ancient tribal technique to catch bats for food.(n)

programme.title: Bear Grylls: Born Survivor

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Iraq war veteran Damon Werth asks Gibbs and the team to investigate the death of another former marine, who was murdered while working as a lorry driver, so Ziva hits the road to catch the killer. Joe Spano and Paul Telfer guest star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a Navy captain is killed in a robbery that went badly wrong, Gibbs' former mother-in-law surfaces as a witness in the investigation, and it transpires the victim had ties to a drug cartel that murdered the agent's first wife Shannon and daughter Kelly. Guest starring Gena Rowlands.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine is found with a gunshot wound six years after disappearing in Afghanistan, and the team discovers he vanished while carrying out an undercover operation. Gibbs suspects the wife could be hiding valuable information, but when a second woman challenges the soldier's identity and he subsequently dies in hospital, the team uncovers what really happened on that fateful mission.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents reluctantly team up with the coast guard to investigate the apparent murder of a Navy diver who was trying to recover a sunken ship and its treasure, and Gibbs finds a prime suspect in a wealthy doctor who had bankrolled the underwater mission. Starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A reporter for the Navy Times is found stabbed to death - and the team learns he had been going to meet a call girl linked to three other murders. Gibbs decides to ask former madam Holly Snow for help in tracking her down. Crime drama, guest starring Dina Meyer (Saw), with Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The team is called to a wedding reception where the bridegroom's mother has been found dead. The discovery that she was a lawyer working on a controversial case leaves a number of potential suspects, each with a professional grudge - but the car containing all the evidence from the crime scene is later stolen. Starring George Eads and Jorja Fox.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man accused of murdering his wife and colleagues barricades himself and a hostage in a casino hotel room. programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

Starring William Petersen, Teal Redmann and Paul Guilfoyle.(n)

programme.desc: A US Marine, a waitress and a chef are shot dead at a diner, in what is thought to be a bungled robbery. However, when the team arrives to investigate, a previously unknown witness emerges from the eatery's freezer, claiming the killer had an unusual tattoo. The statement rings alarm bells for LaSalle, who realises the circumstances of the killings match those of his first-ever case with Pride 10 years earlier, which remained unsolved after Hurricane Katrina devastated the crime scene. Convinced their killer has struck again, he and Pride work together once again in an attempt to achieve closure once and for all. Naval crime drama, starring Lucas Black and Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A string of house robberies at Christmas takes a bloody turn when one of the victims, a Navy Commander's wife, is found dead at the scene. Among the items stolen is a laptop containing sensitive data, and the team is able to track the computer to a moving car. However, when the police intercept the driver, it turns out to be none other than Dr Wade's adopted son Danny. Naval crime drama, guest starring Christoper Meyer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Deeks places his job in danger when he shoots and kills an unarmed man during a mission to retrieve Semtex explosives from a marine warehouse, prompting unexpected emotions for Kensi as she contemplates losing her partner. Crime drama, starring Eric Christian Olsen and Daniela Ruah.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: When Emilia and Margot Vance - two attractive twins in their 30s - are found dead, the team fears the Gig Harbour Killer might have returned. A statue of Castor and Pollux used as a bludgeon, an elaborate astrological display alluding to the constellation Gemini, and a severed human finger are found as Finn and her colleagues investigate the scene of the crime. All the evidence seems to indicate that the twin-obsessed Paul Winthrop is back for sure - but the scope of the crime also suggests the murderer may have enlisted the aid of an accomplice. Drama, starring Ted Danson and Elisabeth Shue.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Cyber
programme.desc: A new code exploits a printer's design flaw, allowing cyber-arsonists to set fires remotely by using wi-fi data connections, and Brody gets a blast from the past when he discovers the person responsible. Meanwhile, Elijah has personal problems when his ex-wife decides to move to San Diego with their daughter. Patricia Arquette stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Cyber
programme.desc: Following an explosion at a cinema, Avery and her team go in search of a bomber who intends to expose the truth about society's over-reliance on technology. As the investigation progresses, Ramirez and Nelson find a website which features a video of the bombing along with a sinister explanation, and they face a race to catch the culprit before the next bomb goes off. Patricia Arquette and James Van Der Beek star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSIs investigate the murder of a wealthy couple, and gradually begin to suspect the motive could lie in an unexpected love triangle. Meanwhile, a key piece of evidence leads Horatio to expose a doctor hiding secrets of his own - and a mistake by Delko raises fears that he may have returned to duty too soon after his shooting.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Frank steps on a land mine and realises he cannot remove his foot without triggering the device, leaving Horatio and the bomb disposal team facing the delicate task of deactivating it. Meanwhile, Delko breaks up a domestic dispute while off duty - only to become the subject of a lawsuit. Rex Linn and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A flu-stricken Grissom is dragged into work from his sickbed to solve a murder and help ensure that a 10-month investigation by Deputy DA Madeline Klein does not fall apart. The search for forensic evidence soon takes him to the chief suspect's apartment - but it is destroyed just as he arrives, making it clear that someone is leaking key information about the case.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The chief suspect in the murder of several homeless men appears to be a schizophrenic street performer. Detectives Lupo and Bernard's problems compound when they find evidence suggesting a possible copycat is at work. Jeremy Sisto and Anthony Anderson star.(n)

programme.desc: Natalia is arrested for the murder of her abusive ex-husband Nick Townsend, but the team is sidelined from the investigation by Internal Affairs, leaving it up to Horatio and Calleigh to prove her innocence. In a separate investigation, a wealthy single man is found dead in his mansion - and subsequent developments reveal the two cases are related.(n)

programme.title: Access

programme.desc: A woman reluctantly hires a live-in nanny to look after her three-year-old daughter so she can return to work, but fears the child is growing closer to her minder than her mother. Her paranoia seems justified when the girl disappears without trace, and she uncovers the terrible truth about the stranger she allowed into her home. Thriller, starring Ashley Scott and Mekenna Melvin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A hated businesswoman is found dead under an ice sculpture with her heart completely frozen. The investigators identify liquid nitrogen as the cause and discover a number of suspects among her employees and associates. Meanwhile, a woman's body falls onto the roof of a school bus - and the ensuing investigation leads Mac and Danny to a dangerous new designer drug.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. In a further bizarre twist, Abby later finds what seems to be a new video on her computer - and the case takes on fresh urgency with the discovery that it is actually a live feed, suggesting the murderer is somewhere on the premises.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a religious website creator leads Bernard and Lupo to a network of corruption in a charitable foundation that provides the motive for the crime. The case becomes even more complicated when the suspect manages to avoid prosecution by being granted asylum, leaving McCoy fighting for his career.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates when a journalist is found murdered, but the case presents new evidence for an old crime involving a man serving a life sentence for spying for the Chinese government. Keith Carradine guest stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a man who was learning how to chat up women at a nightclub, and soon has a long list of suspects. Meanwhile, Horatio tries to help Delko's sister Marisol, who has been arrested on drug charges. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Alana De La Garza star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: DB Russell heads to New York to help Mac search for his kidnapped girlfriend Christine, and James Boyd arranges to meet up with the gang to drop off the diamonds and release the hostages. With the CSI team monitoring his every movement, Boyd starts to ask too many questions and the captors begin to suspect he has involved the police. Conclusion of the two-part crossover between the Las Vegas and New York CSI franchises, starring Gary Sinise and Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate the private life of a murdered Navy captain whose actions may have led to his death, while McGee finds his ideal woman on the internet - but it turns out she is too good to be true. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray, Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Inquiries into the death of a marine land the team squarely in the middle of an inner-city gang war - and a message found at the scene of the crime seemingly implicates Gibbs. Forced to confront a secret from his past, he calls his mentor Mike Franks for help. Drama, guest starring Muse Watson and Kari Coleman, with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Kensi and the team hunt for an electromagnetic pulse device that was stolen from a college research facility, and could destroy Los Angeles if activated, killing millions of people. Elsewhere, Sam is on the lookout for a Christmas present for his daughter. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell, LL Cool J and Daniela Ruah.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The concluding instalment of a two-part crossover with the original NCIS series sees Sebastian joining Abby Sciuto in Washington, DC to pick through the forensic evidence relating to the aircraft murders. Meanwhile, DC agent Ellie Bishop heads to New Orleans to help Pride and his team track down the chief suspect - Abby's brother Luca. Naval crime drama, guest starring Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Agents G Callen and Sam Hanna investigate after a naval officer is killed during an LAPD shootout, with two other men who died in the gun battle being identified as members of a Mexican drug cartel. Spin-off drama following the exploits of the Los Angeles-based Office of Special Projects, an elite NCIS division specialising in undercover assignments. Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man is killed by a bear in what initially appears to have been an accidental encounter - until the team realises he may have been set up as bait. Further investigations suggest his death is linked to the murders of a call girl and her boyfriend, leading to the discovery of an illegal prostitution business that caters for wealthy Miami clients. Drama, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jonny is dismayed when Jac risks being late for Emma's christening to help Elliot operate on a patient with a rare heart condition not seen at the hospital in more than a decade. Harry becomes determined to find his own area of specialism after seeing Raf being photographed by a medical journal for his work with the resus team, while a man with an abscess in his rectum refuses to be operated on by a woman, but the only male surgeon Serena can find is Guy - and it's well outside his comfort zone.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: It's inspection day so Connie gives the staff a pep talk - unaware of the problems in store. Two soldiers are injured in an explosion during a training exercise, but Rita can't understand why one of them is lying about the accident. A computer hacker tries to spread a little happiness, although it comes at a price that lands him in the ED - and as the doctors treat the patient's illness, Robyn inadvertently causes a near-disaster by spreading his virus to Holby's computer system. Honey catches Big Mac taking stock from the food bank, and Zoe and Max rekindle their passion.(n)

programme.title: Our Zoo
programme.desc: Adam the bear escapes, only for George to be badly injured in the process of retrieving him, and as Dr Ford treats his injuries, June is shocked to learn how close her father was to death. It's the worst possible thing that could happen as the Mottersheads need urgent funds to finish building the bear enclosure, and with no further help from the bank, George decides to organise a charity benefit at Selborne Hall. Lee Ingleby, Liz White, Honor Kneafsey, Anne Reid, Peter Wight and Ralf Little star.(n)

programme.title: Service
programme.desc: A weekly service of worship from one of the country's churches.(n)

programme.title: Mayday
programme.desc: Investigation into high-profile air disasters, re-creating events on disaster-hit flights, to uncover the causes of the crashes.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: One O'Clock and Farming Weather
Victoria Wood's Nice Cup of Tea
programme.desc: The comedienne presents a two-part documentary about Britain's love affair with tea, travelling from the back streets of Calcutta to the bright lights of Shanghai to find out how one small plant united East and West, triggered wars and helped win them. Along the way she witnesses a world of chai wallahs, opium smokers and Assam tea-pickers, and asks how the cuppa became such an important part of British life.(n)

programme.title: The Sunday Game Live

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.(n)

programme.title: What Are You Eating
programme.desc: Up until the 1950s, food was a relatively simple matter, with narrow choice and a constant battle to keep food fresh. Fast forward to the present day and mass production, intensive farming, refrigeration, freezing and food technology have provided more choice and lower prices. However, a sizeable proportion of food is now processed to maintain freshness, leading presenter Philip Boucher-Hayes to ask if people really know what they are eating. In the first edition, the presenter examines how the Irish consumer has changed over the years, and is joined by chef Hilary O'Hagan to look at processed meat products and the Paleo diet.(n)

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: Trigger threatens to have Robbie arrested, prompting Carol to take desperate measures to silence him. Tensions in the Bishop household run high as Decco struggles to keep Kerri-Ann and Eileen out of each other's way. Meanwhile, Wayne fears the truth will be exposed when Meredith gets closer to Doug and Orla.(n)

programme.title: At Your Service
programme.desc: Hotelier Francis Brennan offers more advice to people struggling to make their mark in the hospitality business. His latest client is Caroline Workman, who has a plan to set up holiday rentals in the grounds of her family's country house.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather

programme.title: Brendan O'Carroll: My Family at War
programme.desc: Writer and comedian Brendan O'Carroll tells the story of the Irish Easter Rising, in which 1,600 Irish rebels took over the centre of Dublin in Easter week 1916. Despite overwhelming odds, the rebels held out against the forces of the British Empire for six days until they were driven into submission. Three of the rebels were O'Carroll's uncles, and on the centenary of the revolt, he looks into the part his family played in it, and explores how the Rising signalled the birth of today's Republic of Ireland.(n)

programme.title: Clean Break
programme.desc: Injured and on the run, Danny Dempsey desperately seeks somewhere to hide, and as word spreads about the abduction, it will not be long before someone figures out who else is involved. Meanwhile, the kidnappers take drastic action to hold onto their money and stay out of the clutches of the law. Wexford-set drama, starring Damien Molony.(n)

programme.desc: Drama based on the best-selling books by Henning Mankell, starring Kenneth Branagh as a Swedish detective recently estranged from his wife and struggling to readjust while fighting a rising tide of violence. Inspector Kurt Wallander searches for a link between three apparently motiveless murders, and tries to identify a girl who doused herself in petrol and burned to death. With Sarah Smart and Sadie Shimmin.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. The team's fears become a reality when a building comes under attack by a rampaging shooter, leaving Harry and Nikki trapped inside while a helpless Leo is forced to watch on CCTV as the dramatic events unfold. Guest starring Phyllis Logan.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Meet the big birds, a feathered family who've never flown a day in their lives. From ostriches to kiwis, these bizarre birds appear to be nature's greatest novelty act. How they came to be and how they continue to survive is a fascinating tale that has long captivated David Attenborough. In this programme, he tells a story of dedicated dads, enormous eggs and a serious need for speed. And far from being the court jesters of the animal world, these flightless curiosities once nearly ruled the planet.(n)

Their main mission is to take a boat out to Seal Rocks, an area renowned as hosting one of the last colonies of grey nurse sharks. Brandon Walters challenges his friend to swim with the predators and take an underwater photograph of them - in case one day they are gone for good.(n)

programme.title: Cogar
programme.desc: In a programme first shown in 2011 to mark the centenary of the 1911 Census, Catherine Foley learns more about her home village of Baile na nGall in Co Waterford and those who lived there. Three people begin to stand out for her as she interviews neighbours and examines old roll-books and birth certificates.(n)

programme.title: From Paris with Love
programme.desc: An aide at the American embassy in Paris longs to become a CIA agent, but gets more than he bargained for when he is assigned to assist an trigger-happy secret operative. The agent leads him on a dangerous journey through the city's underworld as they fight to prevent a terrorist attack on the city. Action thriller, with John Travolta and Jonathan Rhys Meyers.(n)

programme.title: Wwoofail

programme.desc: National and international weather.(n)

programme.title: Hatfields & McCoys
programme.desc: Judge Hatfield fails in his attempt to convince Anse that he should let the law deal with the ongoing dispute with the McCoys, and the brothers shake hands before going their separate ways. When a lookout spreads the word that Anse is leading his men to the jailhouse to break out his incarcerated family members, the McCoys form a posse - and the two clans come face to face in a gunfight at Grapevine Creek. Fact-based drama, starring Kevin Costner and Bill Paxton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Super 4 (R) (T)
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go (R) (T)
programme.desc: Tracy brothers Scott and Virgil try to find a way to shut down a dangerous device, which is capable of harnessing energy from the Aurora Borealis. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, featuring the voice of Thomas Brodie-Sangster(n)

programme.title: Ninjago: Rise of the Snakes (R) (T)
programme.desc: Animation. Four ninja warriors battle dark Lord Garmadon and his skeleton army(n)

programme.title: Weekend (T)
programme.desc: Hart to Hart actress Stefanie Powers and Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts join Aled Jones in the studio, and balladeer Chris de Burgh speaks to the host about the release of his new album, before performing his most famous hit: The Lady in Red. Plus Georgie Barrat is on hand with the latest technology review(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote (R) (T)
programme.desc: A former student of Jessica's, now working as a reporter, brings the crime writer new evidence on a 30-year-old scandal involving Cabot Cove's founding families. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote (R) (T)
programme.desc: Amateur sleuth Jessica Fletcher is caught up in a case of mistaken identity at an airport and kidnapped by bungling crooks. Starring Angela Lansbury(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Troubled Waters (T)
programme.desc: (1975, Police/Crime Drama) The slovenly sleuth sets out on a pleasure cruise to Acapulco. However, one of the passengers is planning to kill his lover to stop her blackmailing him, and has arranged a cast-iron alibi. But when the crime is discovered, the captain looks to Columbo to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Vaughn, Dean Stockwell, Patrick Macnee and Poupee Bocar(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family (R) (T)
programme.desc: The team assists 39-year-old mother of three Miriam Aragon in her search for her Salvadoran father. After growing up in Wales with her single mother and only finding out about her father's identity at the age of 19, Miriam is desperate to find him. Meanwhile, 48-year-old Annie Sims is determined to find her birth mother, who gave her up for adoption as a baby, but kept her older sister. Following the birth of her own daughters, Annie's compassion for her biological mother has grown, and she hopes to find her and hear her side of the story. Presented by Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: The Chase (R) (T)
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught(n)

programme.title: The X Factor (R) (T)
programme.desc: The long-running talent contest returns, bringing with it a reunion for the judging panel, as veterans Nicole Scherzinger, Sharon Osbourne and Louis Walsh all reclaim their seats, joining show creator Simon Cowell to assess the latest crop of would-be stars. Also coming back to the X Factor family this year is presenter Dermot O'Leary, who takes over hosting duties from Caroline Flack and Olly Murs. As ever, the contest gets under way with the auditions stage, in which Cowell and co will be expected to successfully identify the stars of tomorrow from the thousands of hopeful competitors taking to the stage(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me (T)
programme.desc: (2010, Science Fiction) A criminal mastermind hopes to seal his reputation as the greatest villain of them all by stealing the moon. First he needs to get his hands on a shrinking ray owned by a rival evil genius, and adopts three orphan girls to help him - but finds that fatherhood brings out his long-buried caring side. Animated comedy, with the voices of Steve Carell, Jason Segel, Russell Brand and Julie Andrews(n)

programme.title: News: UTV Live (T)
programme.desc: Round-up of news, plus analysis and sporting headlines(n)

programme.title: Ellie Simmonds: Swimming with Dolphins (T)
programme.desc: The gold-medal winning Paralympic athlete takes a rare break in her extensive training regime to fulfil a childhood dream - to swim with wild dolphins. Since the moment she first learned to swim at the age of three, Ellie has been inspired by the prospect of one day taking to the water alongside these ocean-bound mammals. However, an intense fear of open water means she has never dived in the ocean. Now, she sets out on a journey to conquer her phobias, one that takes her from Cardigan Bay in Wales to southern Mozambique, and the coastal waters of Ponta do Ouro. Along the way, she offers swimming lessons to young orphans, meets champion free-diver Hanli Prinsloo, and has an unexpected encounter with migrating humpback whales(n)

programme.title: The X Factor (T)
programme.desc: Simon Cowell and old friends/rivals Louis Walsh, Sharon Osbourne and Nicole Scherzinger preside over another round of auditions from the opening weekend, as more would-be pop icons discover whether they have a chance at stardom. Also on hand to offer congratulations or condolences is veteran X Factor host Dermot O'Leary(n)

programme.title: Victoria (T)
programme.desc: New series. In 1838, at the age of 18, young princess Alexandrina's life is transformed when she ascends the throne of Great Britain and becomes Queen Victoria. As monarch in her own right, the young Victoria suddenly finds herself freed of the repressive shackles placed on her by her mother's advisor, Conroy, and builds a new alliance with the charismatic prime minister Lord Melbourne. However, her inexperience makes her susceptible to mistakes - and ultimately scandal. Period drama, starring Jenna Coleman(n)

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones (R) (T)
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point (R) (T)
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot(n)

programme.title: The Railway: Keeping Britain on Track

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China face the challenge of working to a tight budget as they continue with the Saab 900 Turbo restoration.(n)

programme.title: What Happened Next
programme.desc: A helicopter pilot attempts to rescue a man perched on a crane. Plus, a look at what happens to sky divers whose chutes open prematurely.(n)

programme.title: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Firefighters tackling a blaze in Los Angeles find they must put their trust in a unique chemical reaction. Plus, a look at what happens when a fire hose takes on a life of its own.(n)

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Dangerous Davies investigates the death of stock-car driver Geoff Fallon during a world championship race, discovering a father and son could hold the perfect motive for the man's murder. Meanwhile, Aspinall's return to the bottle threatens his promotion hopes. Detective drama, guest starring Aiden Gillen, Michelle Collins, Jamie Foreman and Kevin Doyle, alongside Peter Davison and Rob Spendlove.(n)

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.sub-title: Once Upon a Time on the Westway.
programme.desc: The team struggles to name a suspect when recently released criminal Jimmy Vincent is murdered as he prepares to publish his explosive memoirs. Before long, they learn the gun used to kill the ex-con was also used in a heist bearing all the hallmarks of one of his trademark crimes. The Who singer Roger Daltrey guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: The team are called in to investigate the death of a man who'd been living a hermit-like existence for years, although Dangerous soon deduces he can't have been living alone. The post mortem confirms he was killed, but the case soon takes a horrifying turn when a search of the victim's home reveals an old movie showing a child's murder. Meanwhile, Mod's new job as a children's entertainer leads to an unexpected meeting with a potential love interest. Jeff Rawle, Celia Imrie and Hywel Bennett guest star.(n)

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.sub-title: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Willesden.
programme.desc: When comedian Bunny Hopper (guest star Roy Hudd) collapses and dies on stage, a heart attack seems the probable cause. However, the post-mortem reveals that he had ingested rat poison. Not only was Bunny married, but he had a long list of female friends all over the country with three regular girlfriends in Willesden alone - all of whom were at the club the night he died. With most of the squad away on a special assignment, Dangerous and Mod start interviewing all of the suspects. Drama, starring Peter Davison and Sean Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo are called in to find the murderer of an eight-year-old girl, a case which dredges up disturbing memories for Dalziel, who investigated a similar incident in the same area 15 years earlier. The townsfolk are sure a missing local man is guilty of both crimes, but new evidence soon points toward a more complex solution. Feature-length detective drama, starring Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan, Joanna David, Ronald Pickup and Kaye Wragg.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: A woman is released from prison after a 35-year campaign to clear her of murder - which is bad news for Dalziel, who was the investigating officer responsible for her conviction all those years ago. With his reputation at stake, the bluff copper decides to reinvestigate - and soon uncovers a link with the secret services. Feature-length drama, with guest appearances by Shirley Anne Field, Leslie Phillips and Tom Bell alongside Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A clubber is found dead from a suspected drug overdose - but the autopsy results reveal an even more disturbing truth. A preliminary investigation turns up a wealth of suspects, and brings Dalziel face to face with a ghost from his past. Detective drama, starring Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and Bernard Cribbins.(n)

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: A child is kidnapped and a talking doll is left in her bed. The toy mentions Murdoch by name and asks if he wants to play. As the detective chases down the culprit, he is confronted by more dolls taunting him with clues and ultimately threatening the safety of someone dear to him. Crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson.(n)

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Australian detective drama set in 1959, starring Craig McLachlan as a maverick country town doctor. Blake returns from Singapore to discover that Danny has been replaced by a new constable, who is not yet trusted by his station colleagues. When police are called to the Town Hall after a councillor is found dead, Blake suspects foul play - but he must tread carefully among the top brass, who doubt his unorthodox methods.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team takes on three cases at once in-between major murder investigations. Harry deals with a hit-and-run on a council estate, Leo investigates the cause of a fire that left a woman dead, and Nikki is called out when a bride-to-be collapses and dies on her hen night. Starring Tom Ward, William Gaminara and Emilia Fox.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe

programme.desc: Sharon and Tracey's heating breaks down, leaving them with no one to turn to - except their man-hungry neighbour Dorien. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.(n)

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: A chauffeur is found dead in a stretch limousine, stabbed in the neck with a broken champagne bottle. Dangerous investigates, and begins to uncover a link between the case and a London cabbie who disappeared to Montevideo after finding £2million in the back of his taxi 10 years previously. Drama, starring Peter Davison and Sean Hughes.(n)

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Businessman Daniel Boden is found stabbed to death at the wheel of his Land Rover, and Dangerous discovers he was caught up in a lucrative insurance fraud set up by a secret gentleman's club. There are no forensic clues in the vehicle, so the only lead is a phone number Boden called shortly before he died. Peter Davison stars.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: A landlady's husband is driven insane by jealousy, taking the regulars at their pub hostage as he attempts to find out whether she has been unfaithful. Little does he realise that among his captives is an off-duty Dalziel - who must try to avert disaster as the siege spirals out of control. Feature-length detective drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Detective Andy Dalziel investigates a mysterious death at a local hunt, only to find there are more suspects than hard clues, wondering whether it is a group of saboteurs out of control or something more sinister. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and David Royle.(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: An embalmed body is found washed up on Whitby beach, and turns out to be just the first in a spate of mysterious and seemingly unrelated deaths. The intrepid duo's investigations turn up an equally bizarre set of leads including ex-Cold War spies, Dracula's black dog and an old flame from Dalziel's past. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A dying man asks the team to clear the name of his son, a talented junior golfer who committed suicide after being implicated in the murder of a 10-year-old boy. Aiding the investigation is a former chief superintendent who admits she always had doubts about the teenager's guilt, but the committee members of the exclusive golf club where the victim's body was discovered prove reluctant to help the officers with their inquiries. Isla Blair and Cheri Lunghi guest star.(n)

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick High Court Judge's daughter is arrested during a demonstration, presenting him with the challenge of getting her off the hook without falling foul of powerful enemies he has made in his single-minded push to the top of the legal profession. Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden and Caroline Langrishe star.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman, a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue. Put in charge of a new department, she is dismayed to discover the unit is to be manned by a motley crew of old-school former detectives who know little about modern police procedure. However, when they re-examine the case of a man whose conviction for murder 20 years ago has just been overturned, their combined experience and unorthodox methods bring interesting results. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and James Bolam play Redman's veteran team, with Jon Finch, Tim Woodwork and Philip Bretherton.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart and Iain head to Manchester, where a landlord is owed £8,000 in rent arrears and has already called for police back-up. As tempers rise, the pair must find a way to handle a situation that is spiralling dangerously out of control. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase £3,000 owed to a firm of letting agents, before tracking a debtor who was accidentally over-paid for a job. Plus, Stewart and Iain face an eviction that is set to test their patience.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on people living on state welfare in Portsmouth. Chris says he is looking for work, but that there are more shops closing down than opening up, while Carly and Drew spend their time playing darts, shopping and looking after their children, but they long for a better future. Barbara has a foot injury and is stuck between two benefit categories, meaning she has no money to live on, and Robert works as a part-time cleaner, but is stressed by the pressure the job centre is putting on him and the amount of rejection he faces as he searches for more work.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of people struggling to live on state welfare, something made all the more difficult by their individual battles with the bulge. Blossom lives in Brighton and has various health problems. Now she has discovered she many have cervical cancer and needs exploratory surgery - but at 25 stone, doctors have told her she is too fat to go under general anaesthetic. In Bexhill, Gina and Gary claim more than £10,000 a year in benefits. Gina has always been big but now she worries she has symptoms of diabetes. Archie near Manchester tips the scales at 26 stone and hasn't had a full-time job for six years. However, for four weeks of the year he earns money dressing up as Father Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Shock Docs
programme.desc: Documentary profiling a selection of pensioners who are determined to grow old disgracefully. Among those highlighted are fame-hungry 62-year-old Jane Buckle from Hungerford, who is on a mission to become as famous as Beyonce by performing a `granny rap' with Wu Tang Clan, and Brighton resident Lynn Ruth Miller, who - at 82 years of age - is thought to be the world's oldest burlesque artist. In Manchester, 72-year-old triple divorcee Sophia is on the hunt for a toy-boy, and Cambridge punk-granny Annalisa refuses to let approaching her 90th year slow her down.(n)

However, bringing his former spouse to justice is harder than he anticipated, not least because she has also been targeted by the criminal she is investigating. Action comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Jennifer Aniston, Gio Perez, Joel Garland, Jason Kolotouros and Matt Malloy.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. Rick enjoys the prominence of fish and seafood in the cuisine found in the cities of Kolkata and Chennai, cooking dishes including prawns in coconut milk and his mum's British Raj curry.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits Mumbai in search of the bombil, the fish used in Bombay duck, and also enjoys Parsee hospitality and learns about their contribution to Indian cuisine. He then travels south to Pondicherry, where locals prepare Indian dishes with a French twist, before heading north along the coast to Mamallapuram to sample one of the best fish curries he has ever had. Rick also demonstrates how to make popular Parsee chicken dish sali murgh and personal favourite aloo mattar.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef goes in search of the best chicken korma in Lucknow, learns the complexities of making rice dish pulao and joins thousands of partygoers at one of India's major Hindu festivals. Further north in Punjab, he observes the age-old process involved in the production of the unrefined sugar known as jaggery and is recruited as a guest judge to find the state's new `Star Chef'. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the state of Rajasthan, a land of palaces and hilltop forts, where he cooks a biryani fit for a royal banquet. He then heads north to the mountainous region of Himachal Pradesh, and joins local nobility at a gathering in their home village and has an audience with the Dalai Lama.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits a five-star hotel in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, employing local housewives for genuine home-cooked dishes and samples chettinad chicken, a dish inspired by spices brought back from both East and West by merchants. In Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, he meets India's first MasterChef winner, and marks the end of his culinary journey with a small gathering of friends at his bungalow to reveal the outcome of his search for the perfect curry.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. Rick enjoys the prominence of fish and seafood in the cuisine found in the cities of Kolkata and Chennai, cooking dishes including prawns in coconut milk and his mum's British Raj curry.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits Mumbai in search of the bombil, the fish used in Bombay duck, and also enjoys Parsee hospitality and learns about their contribution to Indian cuisine. He then travels south to Pondicherry, where locals prepare Indian dishes with a French twist, before heading north along the coast to Mamallapuram to sample one of the best fish curries he has ever had. Rick also demonstrates how to make popular Parsee chicken dish sali murgh and personal favourite aloo mattar.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef goes in search of the best chicken korma in Lucknow, learns the complexities of making rice dish pulao and joins thousands of partygoers at one of India's major Hindu festivals. Further north in Punjab, he observes the age-old process involved in the production of the unrefined sugar known as jaggery and is recruited as a guest judge to find the state's new `Star Chef'. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the state of Rajasthan, a land of palaces and hilltop forts, where he cooks a biryani fit for a royal banquet. He then heads north to the mountainous region of Himachal Pradesh, and joins local nobility at a gathering in their home village and has an audience with the Dalai Lama.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits a five-star hotel in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, employing local housewives for genuine home-cooked dishes and samples chettinad chicken, a dish inspired by spices brought back from both East and West by merchants. In Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, he meets India's first MasterChef winner, and marks the end of his culinary journey with a small gathering of friends at his bungalow to reveal the outcome of his search for the perfect curry.(n)
